name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank6Convo1_2250
text_en: And right there is the secret to making this work. Communication. If kissing is what you want, then kissing you shall have.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo1_1
text_en: Mmm?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo1_2
text_en: Eleanor?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo1_3
text_en: Why do you even use this? You can talk telepathically, right?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo1_4
text_en: Just how infested ARE you?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo1_5
text_en: Just checking you're alive. [End.]

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo1_6
text_en: Shrewd question.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo1_7
text_en: Are you asking out of concern, or idle curiosity?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo1_8
text_en: Alive and now mildly annoyed.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo1_9
text_en: Cheerio.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo1_10
text_en: It’s about two things, honestly. Control and art.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo1_11
text_en: Concern.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo1_12
text_en: Idle curiosity. [End.]

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo1_13
text_en: Ah. How sweet.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo1_14
text_en: Can I suggest you find something else with which to occupy your time?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo1_15
text_en: I am, after all, the very picture of frailty.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo1_16
text_en: Try prancing up to Arthur and asking about his haemorrhoids.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo1_17
text_en: This is your first and only warning. I am not an exhibit.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo1_18
text_en: Telepathy doesn’t give you control?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo1_19
text_en: How is a chat message 'art'?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo1_20
text_en: Look. I was raised to be polite. It’s a Britannic thing.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo1_21
text_en: Because I have to compose every sentence. I don’t just get to dump meaning wholesale into your head.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo1_22
text_en: Perhaps you'd like to mop my brow as I recline upon my fainting couch?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo1_23
text_en: Politeness is all about not letting the other person know how you feel about them.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo1_24
text_en: That would be easy. Lazy. Uninteresting.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo1_25
text_en: Which is hard, when your mind is effectively plugged into theirs.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo1_26
text_en: Telepathy is about as nuanced as a boot up the arse.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo1_27
text_en: I didn't say it was concern for YOU. [End.]

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo1_28
text_en: Perhaps.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo1_29
text_en: Careful.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo1_30
text_en: I bite.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo1_31
text_en: Ah! You are being circumspect. Treating me as the fearsome lamia I am.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo1_32
text_en: You should have met me BEFORE I was infested.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo1_33
text_en: For instance, right now I could be feeling like wrapping your guts around a stick...

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo1_34
text_en: By comparison, text is fascinating.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo1_35
text_en: ... or feeling giddy as a schoolgirl because you’re finally talking to me.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo1_36
text_en: 'Read between the lines'?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo1_37
text_en: Largely because of what it doesn’t say.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo1_38
text_en: You don’t know. But if this were a telepathic conversation, you would.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo1_39
text_en: Exactly. Before Höllvania, before the Techrot, I depended on text to make my living. Now it’s just a luxury. A whimsy.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo1_40
text_en: Something to play with.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo1_41
text_en: To pass the time while I wait for my body to turn into a chimera I barely recognize.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo1_42
text_en: Does it help?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo1_43
text_en: Um... have fun with that. [End.]

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo1_44
text_en: Oh, yes. After all...

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo1_45
text_en: Sounds like you just prefer to hide behind a screen. [End.]

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo1_46
text_en: So it's about not showing your feelings?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo1_47
text_en: Until I choose to, yes. Perhaps it's silly to try to be civilized in this shithole. But...

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo1_48
text_en: ... we all have our little ways of staying sane, don't we?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo1_49
text_en: Can you blame me for taking every inch of privacy I can get?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo1_50
text_en: Clearly I made the right choice.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo2_51
text_en: Do you mind if I pick your brain?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo2_52
text_en: Not literally, ha ha.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo2_53
text_en: Imagine, me scraping bits of jelly out of your trepanned skull!

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo2_54
text_en: Honestly, I'm curious about you. Where you come from, what you've lived through.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo2_55
text_en: I saw some, as you know, and I'd love to see more. But only if you're willing.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo2_56
text_en: No thanks. [End.]

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo2_57
text_en: So you're asking permission now?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo2_58
text_en: Why not.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo2_59
text_en: Suit yourself.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo2_60
text_en: Last time I probed you, you were freshly puked out of an Infested nightmare.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo2_61
text_en: I had to place the security of the Hex above courtesy.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo2_62
text_en: If that's a dealbreaker for you, I understand.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo2_63
text_en: No mind probes. [End.]

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo2_64
text_en: OK. Where do you want to start?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo2_65
text_en: WELL.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo2_66
text_en: Let’s say you felt like taking me on a whistle-stop tour of your favourite memories. Where would YOU start?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo2_67
text_en: Duviri.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo2_68
text_en: The Origin System.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo2_69
text_en: The Entrati Family.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo2_70
text_en: The Lotus.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo2_71
text_en: My best ever bathroom experience. [End.]

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo2_72
text_en: Oh for Sol's sake, grow up.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo2_73
text_en: It's a kingdom I used to rule.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo2_74
text_en: You've barely made it to Lua. In my time, we have colonies on all the planets.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo2_75
text_en: The rest of the clan are... pretty unique. And infested.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo2_76
text_en: She's kind of a mother figure. Also kind of a biological-mechanical-deity-thing.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo2_77
text_en: I love how you just throw that out so casually.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo2_78
text_en: Well, excuse us for being slow off the mark.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo2_79
text_en: Entrati has a family?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo2_80
text_en: Oh, you are speaking my language extremely fluently.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo2_81
text_en: "Oh, just a kingdom, I have loads."

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo2_82
text_en: Though... we aren't taking the best care of this place.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo2_83
text_en: Entrati's had SEX?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo2_84
text_en: Who is she to YOU, though?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo2_85
text_en: Hmmm. I'm not sure I'll like you if you turn out to be royalty.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo2_86
text_en: The thought of what mankind could have done to other worlds makes me queasy.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo2_87
text_en: I genuinely cannot imagine what sort of ghoulish gallery might be in store here.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo2_88
text_en: And why is she a 'The' and not a 'Mrs' or a 'Queen' or whatnot?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo2_89
text_en: Mind if I step inside your mind and take a look?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo2_90
text_en: Mind if I step inside your mind and take a look?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo2_91
text_en: Mind if I step inside your mind and take a look?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo2_92
text_en: Mind if I step inside your mind and take a look?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo2_93
text_en: Go ahead.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo2_94
text_en: Go ahead.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo2_95
text_en: Go ahead.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo2_96
text_en: Go ahead.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo2_97
text_en: On second thoughts - yes I do mind. [End.]

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo2_98
text_en: This is... *astonishing*

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo2_99
text_en: ... there's a future. We make it. As a species.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo2_100
text_en: They're so... human. So petty. Like bickering Gods.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo2_101
text_en: Oh. Oh my.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo2_102
text_en: It's a living metaphor and a fabulous wish-fulfilment paradise AND sheer hell

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo2_103
text_en: I'm sorry, that must seem so obvious to you. But to me...

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo2_104
text_en: And so very much themselves, even though they're... what was the word? Wormed. Through and through.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo2_105
text_en: Natah, Margulis, Lotus. Three queens in darkness.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo2_106
text_en: You did not mention the endless executions bit. For all you know, I might have LIKED the endless executions bit.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo2_107
text_en: So many times I've been convinced we were just going to fizzle out on this rock

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo2_108
text_en: I can't pretend I understand Entrati any better after seeing this lot.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo2_109
text_en: I just want to sit at her knee and listen to her talk.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo2_110
text_en: ... I'm going to need to step away and process this. Dear Sol in heaven.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo2_111
text_en: But we don't. We carry on. Thank you for showing me that.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo2_112
text_en: But it's a comfort to know that whatever else may have changed in your time, families are still at one another's throats.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo2_113
text_en: And now I'm torn between being grateful that you've shown her to me and murderously jealous that you get to be her Champion and I don't.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo3_114
text_en: So. The Void.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo3_115
text_en: I'm honestly quite curious about it. So...

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo3_116
text_en: ... would it be okay to just fire some questions at you?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo3_117
text_en: Sure.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo3_118
text_en: I might not have all the answers, but go ahead.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo3_119
text_en: No. [End.]

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo3_120
text_en: ... and thus you retain that aura of cryptic mystery I so admire.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo3_121
text_en: Your honesty is noted and appreciated.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo3_122
text_en: Excellent. So...

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo3_123
text_en: … how would you sum up what the Void means to you, in a few words?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo3_124
text_en: I feel put on the spot. Is this an interview?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo3_125
text_en: What it “means” to me?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo3_126
text_en: Nobody’s really sure what the Void is. It’s a dimension, it’s an energy field, it’s a shortcut through space, it’s a bolt-hole where the Orokin hid…

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo3_127
text_en: Sorry. Old habits.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo3_128
text_en: Yes.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo3_129
text_en: Fascinating though all that is, it sounds technical. I was more interested in what it means to you. Since you seem to, well, live and breathe it. Literally.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo3_130
text_en: Forgive me. I’m not a journo any more, and you’re not the story. I’m just deeply interested.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo3_131
text_en: Get personal with it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo3_132
text_en: The Void gives me the ability to do impossible things. Project beams of energy, turn insubstantial, all that good shit. Where I come from, it’s what makes Warframes able to do what they do.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo3_133
text_en: The Void drove my parents insane.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo3_134
text_en: The Void was my home for I don’t know how long. It shaped itself to me. Or I shaped it, somehow. Still not clear on what exactly happened.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo3_135
text_en: I’m sorry. Now I feel like a heel for asking.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo3_136
text_en: Did they recover?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo3_137
text_en: Ooh. You have my full attention.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo3_138
text_en: They never had the chance.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo3_139
text_en: By shape you mean… Duviri? Towers and islands and flying horses?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo3_140
text_en: Yeah, I'd rather not. [End.]

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo3_141
text_en: What shape did it take?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo3_142
text_en: I'm good.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo3_143
text_en: Oh Sol. That’s horrible.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo3_144
text_en: Would you rather not talk about this right now?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo3_145
text_en: Yeah. Literally a children’s story brought to life.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo3_146
text_en: There was this book I used to love. ‘Tales of Duviri’. Stories about a magical kingdom, only it was really about emotions and the lessons they can teach you.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo3_147
text_en: The Void brought it to life and I got to live in it. Then it became a prison. But that’s another story.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo3_148
text_en: And this was real? It didn’t feel like a dream?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo3_149
text_en: Another time, then.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo3_150
text_en: Separating parents from children. Turning one against the other. That doesn’t sound coincidental to me.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo3_151
text_en: That sounds like conscious intent.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo3_152
text_en: Like twisted science, almost.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo3_153
text_en: No, Eleanor, being murdered every morning did not feel like a dream. I felt every second of it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo3_154
text_en: I see.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo3_155
text_en: Yeah. There’s something IN the Void. I know that much. The Indifference, the Lidless Eye, the ‘Man in the Wall’. When I say the Void did this, I mean HE did it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo3_156
text_en: I…

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo3_157
text_en: So they’re not one and the same thing?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo3_158
text_en: They could be. I hope they aren’t.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo3_159
text_en: I have to wonder what that’s like.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo3_160
text_en: Words, brought to life. A concrete reality, conjured out of nothing.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo3_161
text_en: Fascinating.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo3_162
text_en: And why is that?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo3_163
text_en: The future basically RUNS on the Void. Interplanetary travel, Warframes, the Tenno... without the Void, none of it works.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo3_164
text_en: Wait. Wait.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo3_165
text_en: The Void is a miracle engine, is what you’re saying?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo3_166
text_en: And I’m already connected to it?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo3_167
text_en: I mean I’m a Warframe. Or a Protoframe. I’m like them.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo3_168
text_en: What do you mean, connected?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo3_169
text_en: And I can do things now. Mind control. Face melting.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo3_170
text_en: Is that where the power’s coming from IN ME? The Void?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo3_171
text_en: Wait, back up. In my time, there’s this… pump. The Heart of Deimos.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo3_172
text_en: One sec. Getting comfortable.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo3_173
text_en: Right. As you were. I can’t wait to hear this.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo3_174
text_en: The Heart of Deimos keeps the whole Origin System bathed in a sort of Void halo. Like background radiation. Anything that draws on Void energy depends on the Heart.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo3_175
text_en: Well now.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo3_176
text_en: If there’s no Heart of Deimos in my time, then how is the Void reaching me?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo3_177
text_en: Because I can feel it, you know. I’m sure I can.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo3_178
text_en: ‘Magic’ seems too small a word for it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo3_179
text_en: What you’re describing is divine.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo4_180
text_en: What’s it like? Having the freedom to swan about in a city filled with plague and know you’ll never have to worry about catching it?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo4_181
text_en: "Swan about" isn’t fair, Eleanor.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo4_182
text_en: I don’t know I won’t catch it. I just haven’t yet.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo4_183
text_en: It’s fantastic. I can help the people in danger.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo4_184
text_en: I’ll speak as I like, thank you very much.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo4_185
text_en: Oh, come on.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo4_186
text_en: And I’ll tell you when you’re out of line.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo4_187
text_en: Suit yourself. [End.]

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo4_188
text_en: I’ve seen how you work. You might have been human once, but now you’re Spanglyboots the Space Elf. All spooky light shows and mystic powers.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo4_189
text_en: I don’t think you can be killed. Not forever. And I know how hard people have tried.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo4_191
text_en: Fine. You got me. Sorry.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo4_192
text_en: Eleanor’s being a bitter lemon today.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo4_193
text_en: Sol, I miss the taste of lemons.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo4_194
text_en: You don’t act scared of the Techrot. Why should you? You have no reason to be.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo4_195
text_en: You’re not going to catch it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo4_196
text_en: Something on your mind?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo4_197
text_en: Have fun with that. [End.]

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo4_198
text_en: Nothing I’d be proud to admit to.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo4_199
text_en: But thanks for checking in, regardless.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo4_200
text_en: You don’t know this thing like I do. It evolves. It mutates. It learns. The Orokin thought they could beat it. They never did.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo4_201
text_en: Maybe you’re right. But we don’t KNOW.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo4_202
text_en: You’re right. I could help people more.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo4_203
text_en: Heh. That was Entrati’s whole schtick. Back when he first appeared with the whole ‘Doktor Friday’ medicine show bit.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo4_204
text_en: I suppose not. And I have no business speculating, really.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo4_205
text_en: It just galls me to see you so above it all, you know?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo4_206
text_en: Oh Gods, I remember now. Eris. The hulks. The surface of Deimos.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo4_207
text_en: I keep forgetting we don’t win against the Techrot.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo4_208
text_en: Ignore me. Oozing blemishes are ugly enough. Self-pity is uglier.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo4_209
text_en: Makes one wonder why he never got infected. His family did, after all.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo4_210
text_en: He managed to protect himself from succumbing, at least. Maybe he’s more like you than you know.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo4_211
text_en: It makes what we’re trying to do here feel pointless, almost.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo4_212
text_en: Sol. Here I am feeling sorry for myself for being a plague victim, and dumping on you for being immune, and you’ve seen whole worlds get eaten by the selfsame poxy crud.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo4_213
text_en: Höllvania’s had a whole bunch of would-be saviours.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo4_214
text_en: The Princess, back in the day. Then Entrati. Viktor. My brother, of course. Now you.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo4_215
text_en: Do you see yourself as a hero?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo4_216
text_en: I think I’ll count what blessings I have.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo4_217
text_en: I’m just trying my best.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo4_218
text_en: Yes. I do.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo4_219
text_en: No, I don’t.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank1Convo4_220
text_en: I don’t believe in heroes.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo4_221
text_en: Good enough. Carry on, soldier.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo4_222
text_en: I simply cannot understand how you were trapped in a storybook kingdom and STILL haven’t outgrown that sort of thing.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo4_223
text_en: I’m glad. Someone who’s lived as many centuries as you have OUGHT to be a grown-up by now.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank1Convo4_224
text_en: Good for you. Because I’ve seen what happened when one little boy thought he’d go off on a Hero’s Journey and started thinking of the rest of us as his supporting characters.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo1_225
text_en: Are you as sick as Lettie seems to think you are?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo1_226
text_en: How’s your personal Infestation going?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo1_227
text_en: What’s the deal with you and Lettie?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_228
text_en: Let’s get this straight. Lettie doesn’t think I’m sick. Lettie thinks I’m a demon.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_229
text_en: I wonder what it’s like to have such a romantic view of the world. You’d think a medic would deal in measurable facts. Ten CC of this, identify the microbes of that.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_230
text_en: It’s not unpleasant, which is more than you can say for most parasitic infestations.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_231
text_en: I can feel the Technocytes swimming in my blood. If I close my eyes I can see sparkles like fairy dust.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_232
text_en: Have you heard what she calls me?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo1_233
text_en: Honestly, no.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo1_234
text_en: ‘La Bruja Metiche’. The nosy witch.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_235
text_en: Yep. She sits there smirking with her phials and potions, her bottles of blood and slivers of skin, her army of ratty familiars skittering all over the place, and she has the temerity to call ME a witch.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_236
text_en: ‘La Bruja Metiche’. The nosy witch. I suppose she could do far worse, considering her vocabulary and flair for creative obscenities.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_237
text_en: It means me well. Can you understand that?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_238
text_en: I have heard her tell Quincy to do some rather inventive things with playground fixtures and parts of his anatomy that left me chuckling over the visual for some time, I must admit.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_239
text_en: Yet she sits there smirking with her phials and potions, her bottles of blood and slivers of skin, her army of ratty familiars skittering all over the place, and she has the temerity to call ME a witch.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_240
text_en: Everything it does, it does out of a sincere wish to fix me up and make me better. If I’m quick and lethal and hard to kill, I’ll be a good host. So it fulfills its part of our symbiotic bargain by giving me shark skin and wolf fangs, along with a tongue like a leather whip.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo1_241
text_en: Very scientific of you. I thought you believed in more spiritual things?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo1_242
text_en: Sounds like you think  the ‘loss of humanity’ part is exaggerated.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo1_243
text_en: I get it, you don’t like each other.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo1_244
text_en: Has it always been this way between you?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo1_245
text_en: She thinks you’ll lose control.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_246
text_en: Well, yes. Living the way we do, how could one not believe in the spiritual world?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_247
text_en: I’m still Eleanor Nightingale. That’s more important to me than being ‘human’ is.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_248
text_en: Don’t get me wrong. I WOULD piss on her if she was on fire.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_249
text_en: I think you can guess the answer to that.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_250
text_en: I know. Sometimes I do, too. I have a recurring nightmare where I rip her throat out just as she puts a bullet through my heart.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_251
text_en: I’ve seen what human beings are capable of. We’re not special. In fact, going by what I’ve seen in your head, we get even worse over time.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_252
text_en: But I’d take my time over it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_253
text_en: But being afraid of something doesn’t make it real. So far I have gone on zero bloody rampages. ZERO.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_254
text_en: Amir’s caused more sodding injuries than I have.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_255
text_en: But Amir is sweet and a bit ditzy, isn’t he? Amir doesn’t have teeth that could gnaw open a tin of rations. So nobody sees Amir as a bomb waiting to go off.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_256
text_en: Well. Except Quincy.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo1_257
text_en: You want to just give up? You sound like Son.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo1_258
text_en: If you were following its agenda, would you even know?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo1_259
text_en: At least the human genome is natural.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_260
text_en: The Void is proof positive that the spiritual is just as real as the material. All your people have done, aside from putting a different name on it, is develop a reliable means of getting there and back.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_261
text_en: Listen. Just because I admit the existence of demonic forces doesn’t mean I’m content to be written off as one.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_262
text_en: I never said that.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_263
text_en: As opposed to following the agenda of a twisty little double helix of nucleotides? You know, that thing humans have done since they started walking upright?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_264
text_en: The likes of Viktor Vodyanoi - and what kind of sobriquet is THAT to choose for yourself - justify their backward views by claiming they are ‘natural’. Biological fundamentalism. Man as the mirror of the Divine and all of that.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_265
text_en: Some people think humanity is sacred. People like Viktor. I’m the ultimate blasphemy in his eyes. Infected, shameless and female.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_266
text_en: “Me not do bidding of microscopic tyrant! Me human being. Me special! Find mate. Reproduce. Protect territory. Ug.”

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_267
text_en: But we’ve been unnatural from the moment we started banging rocks together. Language is a virus, mate. Being human is the blank slate we get to scribble on, not the primal Eden we were kicked out of.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_268
text_en: What’s happening in my system is the result of quite mundane atoms and molecules waltzing together in unexpected and remarkable ways. Any spiritual significance to that will be imparted by me. Not Lettie.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo1_269
text_en: I get it, you don’t like each other.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo1_270
text_en: Has it always been this way between you?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo1_271
text_en: She thinks you’ll lose control.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_272
text_en: Don’t get me wrong. I WOULD piss on her if she was on fire.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_273
text_en: I think you can guess the answer to that.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_274
text_en: I know. Sometimes I do, too. I have a recurring nightmare where I rip her throat out just as she puts a bullet through my heart.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_275
text_en: But I’d take my time over it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_276
text_en: But being afraid of something doesn’t make it real. So far I have gone on zero bloody rampages. ZERO.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_277
text_en: Amir’s caused more sodding injuries than I have.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_278
text_en: But Amir is sweet and a bit ditzy, isn’t he? Amir doesn’t have teeth that could gnaw open a tin of rations. So nobody sees Amir as a bomb waiting to go off.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_279
text_en: Well. Except Quincy.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo1_280
text_en: The Techrot could hijack your mind and you wouldn’t know it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_281
text_en: I mean… yes. You’re right. There are parasites that do that.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_282
text_en: But what if it’s not a parasite? What if it’s a symbiote?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo1_283
text_en: I’ve seen it absorb entire MOONS, Eleanor!

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_284
text_en: And what’s so bloody wonderful about being an unabsorbed moon? Why is the Infested version not an improvement?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_285
text_en: Oh no! A lump of indifferent space rock that could have drifted aimlessly for another few millennia is suddenly alive and interesting! What a catastrophe!

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_286
text_en: It’s the exact same bullshit Viktor’s crew come out with. Sentimental clinging on to whatever something USED to be.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_287
text_en: As if being primordial was the same as being perfect.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo1_288
text_en: You don’t know what you’re talking about. When someone’s lost to the Infestation, they are LOST. Completely unrecognizable.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo1_289
text_en: I understand that you need to try to accept what you've become. You're facing an impossible challenge.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo1_290
text_en: I don’t know if you’re trying to provoke me, but I’ve had to fight for my life against these things. Sometimes you can make out the bits that used to be human. Heads and feet just sticking out of the mass.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo1_291
text_en: Either hate what you've become or embrace it. And something tells me you're someone who learned to give up hating themselves a long time ago.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo1_292
text_en: It’s not a symbiote. It doesn’t CARE what you want. It’s not here to help. It’s an aggressive cancer of a lifeform that only wants to make everything else into itself.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo1_293
text_en: But these demons in your blood are NOT your friends. The best you can do is keep them on a tight leash, Eleanor. Trust. Me.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_294
text_en: Remind me, what are your Warframes made of again?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_295
text_en: You think I don't?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_296
text_en: Do you have any idea what it takes to keep the rage in check? Do you know what the price of this outward serenity is?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_297
text_en: If you see me meditating, I'm not communing with the great cosmic cabbage. I'm cooling down the sodding reactor core.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo1_298
text_en: Infested human beings.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_299
text_en: But their Infestation was shaped and controlled, wasn’t it?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_300
text_en: Just like the Infestation that’s in me now.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_301
text_en: There's SO much I could do and DON'T. Places I could take this... stuff... that you haven't even considered.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_302
text_en: Which means someone, somewhere had the guts to stop thinking of the Infestation as a brainless monster and start looking at what it could become.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_303
text_en: I could walk into their DREAMS. And they wouldn't even know I'd been there.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_304
text_en: Well. This has been an interesting, if uncouth, exchange of views. I had a lovely time. Let's do it again.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo1_305
text_en: Oh, you did NOT just describe Ballas as ‘having guts’.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo1_306
text_en: So… do you think you’re becoming more yourself, not less?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_307
text_en: You know, you’re getting quite emotional. We should finish this conversation another time.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo1_308
text_en: The last time I got hit with a biochemical sledgehammer that left me sprawled on a couch for half the day and had people whispering behind my back that I was turning into a monster, it was called ‘puberty’.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo2_309
text_en: How did you end up here in Höllvania?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo2_310
text_en: What was it like growing up with Arthur?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo2_311
text_en: Long story.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo2_312
text_en: Idyllic. We never fought, not even once. We kept one another’s secrets. He even let me braid his hair.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo2_313
text_en: Should I even bother asking? Or is this a conversation better suited for later?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo2_314
text_en: Are you going to give me the real version?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo2_315
text_en: No wonder everyone else is jealous of me and wants Arthur to be their brother, too.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo2_316
text_en: How nice. [End.]

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo2_317
text_en: I bet he let you practice makeup on him, too.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo2_318
text_en: Later, assuming you haven't skipped town and I haven't mutated into a raging shapeless wad of muscle tissue and mouths.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo2_319
text_en: Perhaps, once I’m sure you won’t go running back and forth between Arthur and me, comparing notes.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo2_320
text_en: Because you might learn things about certain people that you might find hard to stomach.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo2_321
text_en: I can’t imagine he’s opened up to you much.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo2_322
text_en: He’s quite a private guy, yeah.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo2_323
text_en: Aren't I cryptic? Like a Sphinx. Rarr.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo2_324
text_en: Actually, he did do that. Until quite recently, in fact.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo2_325
text_en: I wish he would wear eyeliner more often. He claims it’s too much of a faff. Prefers burnt cork.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo2_326
text_en: Arthur thinks there are some things you shouldn’t talk about. He’s old-fashioned like that. ‘Bad for morale’, he’ll say. ‘Camp chatter.’ ‘Careful, might be circulating enemy propaganda.’

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo2_330
text_en: Which is just what I want.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo2_328
text_en: Always the soldier. Is he ever NOT on duty?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo2_329
text_en: Oh, it runs deep in our family.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo2_331
text_en: I’m having trouble taking YOU seriously.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo2_332
text_en: I don't know, I think he's pretty sexy... for a hungover emo panda.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo2_333
text_en: I'd let you practice makeup on me if you wanted. ;)

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo2_334
text_en: The smudgy dark-eyed look does suit him, but he doesn’t know when to stop with the eyeshadow. He tries to be a moody stubble god, all folded arms and 2am bus stops, but then he keeps going and ends up as a hungover emo panda. And he wonders why people don’t take him seriously.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo2_335
text_en: That is entirely your prerogative and I will not judge you for your choice

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo2_336
text_en: I will even wish you happy hunting, if you are so inclined

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo2_337
text_en: HOW DARE YOU

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo2_338
text_en: Do not disparage the sacred ritual that is Doing One Another's Makeup

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo2_339
text_en: HOWEVER

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo2_340
text_en: We are not even close to being well enough acquainted for that.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo2_341
text_en: If I suspect FOR ONE INSTANT that you are using anything I choose to share with you as leverage to get into his armoured pants...

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo2_342
text_en: ... I will be every inch the monster people think I am, for long enough to make you wish you were back in the execution circus.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo2_343
text_en: Sorry, let me just catch my breath a moment.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo2_344
text_en: ... I'm not saying never. Okay? And it only just occurred to me that this might be the first time, for you.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo2_345
text_en: So I'll give you a pass, this once. But in all seriousness, it's not the sort of thing to joke about.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo2_346
text_en: It meant a lot for Arthur to trust me like that. It meant even more that I was able to make him feel genuinely good about himself.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo2_347
text_en: Blimey. I feel like owe you an apology now, and I don't really do those.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo2_348
text_en: Let's chalk this one up to experience, eh?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo2_349
text_en: Dad used to have an old Army poster from the ‘37 Bombardment on the wall in the downstairs loo. A square-jawed loyal soldier is punching out a scrawny moaner whose glasses go flying off. Caption: “Slap the chap who flaps his trap with crap!”

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo2_350
text_en: Arthur loved it because it was ‘rude’. He took its lesson to heart, though. ‘Don’t talk about things that could hurt the people we care about.’

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo2_351
text_en: Give him a break. It’s good sense, for a fighting team. You can’t sail a leaky ship.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo2_352
text_en: That's not right. If you don't talk about hurtful things, you just... bottle it up.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo2_353
text_en: And if you bottle it up, it can spiral out of control. ... I have some experience with that...

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo2_354
text_en: Precisely. It's all very well and good until it's being invoked to shut you up.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo2_355
text_en: All very well until it’s being invoked to shut you up.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo2_356
text_en: All my life there have been things we NEEDED to talk about. There are conversations we SHOULD have had. Granny Callie. Christopher. The Cavona Mansion. They festered between us.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo2_357
text_en: But no. Talking about it was Simply Not Done. Too much at stake.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo2_358
text_en: So because the alternative was never to feel clean in my own skin again, I made it my business to find out about other things that people didn’t want talked about, and I talked about them. I wrote about the kinds of things that soon had people trying to nudge my car over the edge of a Hibernian mountain pass.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo2_359
text_en: Remember, I’m not from here. What things?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo2_360
text_en: Hibernian what now?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo2_361
text_en: The usual stuff. Corruption at the highest levels of government. Paternity scandals in the Höllvanian royal family. Tainted milk powder being distributed to nursing mothers in ‘undesirable’ sink estates in New Holywell.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo2_362
text_en: Right, yes. Tourist to our time. The usual stuff. Corruption at the highest levels of government. Paternity scandals in the Höllvanian royal family. Tainted milk powder being distributed to nursing mothers in ‘undesirable’ sink estates in New Holywell.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo2_363
text_en: Because when someone tells you to shut up, you do not comply, EVER.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo2_364
text_en: You remind me of Nora Night.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo2_365
text_en: I agree.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo2_366
text_en: I assume that’s a good thing? Tell me about her some time when I’m not in the mood to rip someone’s head off.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo2_367
text_en: Anyway. Arthur wanted me to shut up, for the good of the family. Now I don’t talk at all. Yet for some reason Arthur’s still not happy.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo2_368
text_en: I ask you. What is a sister to do?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_369
text_en: Okay, we’ve known each other a little while now, and you’re from the future, and I think I can trust you to be honest with me about this, so I have to ask the most important question.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_370
text_en: Are we alone? Or did we finally contact something else?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo3_371
text_en: You mean alien life? Not yet, but maybe one day.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo3_372
text_en: The Indifference is the closest we’ve come, unfortunately.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo3_373
text_en: Yeah, we’re alone. Nothing but humans and human-created things.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_374
text_en: Well, shit.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_375
text_en: What IS ‘the Indifference’? I’ve seen glimpses in your mind, but I can’t make sense of it. It makes me want to run and curl up somewhere far away with very thick walls.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_376
text_en: The bleakest possible answer.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_377
text_en: I was really hoping there’d be something out there we could talk to. Something with a truly outside perspective on our species.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo3_378
text_en: We’re still not sure what it is. Or even what it WANTS. We don’t even know if it’s an ancient entity like the Red Veil think it is, or if Albrecht brought it into being somehow.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo3_379
text_en: It's the thing that took Major Rusalka.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_380
text_en: I’m not sure why. Intelligence is intelligence, after all. It shouldn’t matter whether we discover it or create it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_381
text_en: Talk to and… other things, of course.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo3_382
text_en: If I tell you it’s what was possessing Major Rusalka, does that help?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_383
text_en: Oh.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo3_384
text_en: Wait. Just what sort of interaction did you have in mind?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo3_385
text_en: Looking for a fellow tentacle monster to befriend?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_386
text_en: Excuse you. I am not a 'tentacle monster'. I am a monster who happens to have A TENTACLE. One. So far.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_387
text_en: Some kind of communion, I suppose. Not necessarily anything physical. I just want to touch minds with something that not only isn’t human, it isn’t even terrestrial.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_388
text_en: If all I wanted to do was converse with things with tentacles, I'd pop over to the Princess Lucina Zoological Gardens and make friends with the octopus.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_389
text_en: I tried to touch minds with one of Lettie’s rats, once, just to see what would happen.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_390
text_en: ... and now I'm wishing I'd done that. Octopi are highly intelligent. We'd probably be writing poetry together by now. I wonder where that octopus is?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo3_391
text_en: Poor little thing didn't get hurt, did it?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo3_392
text_en: Okay, I have to ask how that went.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_393
text_en: It was a dreadful three seconds for him.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_394
text_en: Someone probably ate it. That's what usually happens to zoo animals in quarantined cities, once supplies run out.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_395
text_en: And whatever didn't get eaten will be riddled with Techrot by now.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_396
text_en: ... which is how it was in the 'dream', isn't it? Only it isn't a dream at all. It happened. Or will happen. Or a version of it will. Something happens at that zoo.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_397
text_en: I'm going to remember as much as I can.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_398
text_en: Don't try to stop me.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_399
text_en: Poor little thing. I’d failed to allow for what touching MY mind would seem like to HIM, you see. Imagine a child lost in an infinite department store, screaming for its mother at the top of its lungs over and over. Everything was enormous and incomprehensible and had NOISES and SHAPES instead of SMELLS.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_400
text_en: I broke the link as fast as I could. He was a little dizzy for an hour or so, then he was fine. I doubt he even remembers what happened to him.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo3_401
text_en: It’s only a rat, come on.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo3_402
text_en: And your side of it? What was it like being a rat?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_403
text_en: I wouldn’t let Lettie hear you say that. Not if you like your organs where they are.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_404
text_en: I don’t know if you’ve ever had the kind of slump where all you want to do is lie in bed and breathe in and out and just exist without doing anything else, but it was a lot like that.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_405
text_en: Very basic. Simple needs met in simple ways.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_406
text_en: Childhood innocence has nothing on rat-consciousness.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo3_407
text_en: Sounds kind of pleasant, the way you talk about it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo3_408
text_en: Are you jealous of a rat?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_409
text_en: Oh, it was. I’m sure being a rat has its bad side, like having to eat your dead brother so the predators won’t sniff him out, but that fleeting moment of simplicity was like a religious breakthrough, almost.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_410
text_en: Sort of.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_411
text_en: I guess being a rat is a lot like being a monk. Live off scraps, make your humble way in the world, never own a car or a house.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo3_412
text_en: Religious breakthrough?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_413
text_en: I just think there’s something heroic about being small and simple with very few needs.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_414
text_en: I thought about being a nun for a long time, believe it or not.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo3_415
text_en: You're going to have to tell me what that is, Eleanor.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo3_416
text_en: A nun?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_417
text_en: Right, yes. It seems they don't have them where you come from.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_418
text_en: Right. Perhaps they don’t have them where you come from.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_419
text_en: Like a devotee of Lua. Shaven head, white or black robes depending on the Aspect, very strict life. You’re expected to focus on holy things to the exclusion of all else. Prayer and meditation every day. Basic diet.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo3_420
text_en: That sounds terrible.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo3_421
text_en: That sounds amazing.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo3_422
text_en: That sounds challenging.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo3_423
text_en: That sounds… like it’s not for me.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_424
text_en: It does, on the face of it. About the only difference between the monastic life and prison is that you’re doing it on purpose.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_425
text_en: It sounds amazing to most young novices, too, until they actually get a taste of the monastic life. I think the quit rate is something like eighty per cent.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_426
text_en: Oh, no. I mean, at first, yes, you’d need to wean yourself off all of the things that society has taught you to need. That phase is probably the hardest.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_427
text_en: It wasn’t for me, either. It turns out I enjoy living in the world far too much.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_428
text_en: But Sol… it’s like there’s some alternate version of me who’s sat on a mountaintop somewhere, incense clouds flowering around her, jet and moonstone beads ticking through her fingers, looking down on me with abject pity.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_429
text_en: Turns out it wasn't for me. I enjoy living in the world far too much.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_430
text_en: But once you’re established, what’s the challenge going to be? Temptation? You’ll never SEE any. The idea is that you cut yourself off from everything that might distract you from the holy.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_431
text_en: I know that’s just a fantasy. As much a fantasy as any of Arthur’s knights-in-armour pabulum.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo3_432
text_en: We all fantasize about having our shit together one day.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo3_433
text_en: I talk to an alternate version of myself all the time. We’ve had meals together. It’s not as crazy as you make it sound.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_434
text_en: Thank you. For some reason that’s an incredibly comforting thing to hear.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_435
text_en: Yes. I keep forgetting that what you’ve lived through amounts to pure bloody madness by any normal standard.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_436
text_en: You know… I’ve never done this before, but I think I’ll try reaching out to her, just in case she exists. Yes. Maybe I can contact ‘Sister Eleanor’ telepathically.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_437
text_en: What’s the worst that could happen?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_438
text_en: I might get some words of guidance from my other self. Imagine that. Oh Lua, I’m quite excited now.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_439
text_en: I think I just wanted reassurance that the Universe hadn’t put all its eggs in one basket. Because if humans are all there is, then the situation’s pretty screwed.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_440
text_en: Ah, well.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_441
text_en: Oh no.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_442
text_en: Oh SHIT.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_443
text_en: THAT THING? That’s the same as your ‘Indifference’?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_444
text_en: I touched it. I’ve touched that thing with the very edge of my mind and I locked the memory away.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_445
text_en: I don’t even remember when it happened. She was giving one of her speeches on the tannoy, and I thought ‘I’ve never probed HER head before, I wonder what’s in there, probably all leather and needles’ and so I reached out and…

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_446
text_en: shitshitshit

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo3_447
text_en: I can’t talk about this yet. I’m sorry.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_448
text_en: What do you think happens after we die?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo4_449
text_en: I’m fine, Eleanor, thanks for asking! How are you?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo4_450
text_en: … are you okay?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo4_451
text_en: I’ve seen enough to know that a personality can survive death.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo4_452
text_en: No more stupid conversations. [End.]

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_453
text_en: Heh.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_454
text_en: Not at all.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_455
text_en: Go on?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_456
text_en: Look, we can talk about the weather if you’d like.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_457
text_en: But I’m not thinking about death in any morbid way, if that’s what you were worried about. I’m happy to keep going for a long while yet.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_458
text_en: (Imagine me lying on my stomach, full-length on the couch, my chin on my hands, looking up at the Pom-2 and waiting expectantly to see what you’re going to type next.)

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_459
text_en: Or, since we’re already at the Mall, we could go get lattes and chat shit about how Lettie is a total bitch for keeping all those pink-n-yellows to herself instead of pilling us up like she oughtta, amirite?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_460
text_en: I just have a lot of long, dark hours to myself and plenty to think about, while my poor little cells twist and turn like croutons in the witches’ broth my bloodstream has now become.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_461
text_en: (I feel dirty for having typed that. Apologies.)

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_462
text_en: I know I’m skipping over a lot of small talk and going right for the jugular, but frankly it’s your bloody fault for being so interesting.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_463
text_en: A time-traveling demigod literally falls into my life, my already ridiculous life, and I’m expected to stand back out of social nicety?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_464
text_en: You can give me perspectives nobody else can. So please. Before I start clawing at the furniture. Talk to me.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo4_465
text_en: We’ve got ‘Cephalons’ where I come from. Glass cubes that used to be human beings, and still express their personality. Mostly.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo4_466
text_en: The Orokin used to transfer their consciousness into stolen bodies, so they could live forever.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo4_467
text_en: All Tenno can use ‘transference’ to pilot Warframes. We’re not tied to a physical form. So it doesn’t make sense to imagine our existence ending when our bodies die.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo4_468
text_en: I'm really not comfortable fueling this obsession of yours, Eleanor.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_469
text_en: Obsession?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_470
text_en: I saw. I don't think an existence that was thought of as a PUNISHMENT by your Orokin is an afterlife worth the name.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_471
text_en: Ew. I think I’d rather be decently dead.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_472
text_en: Of all the disgusting things this planet has in store, I think these Orokin are the worst.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_473
text_en: I wonder if it’s too late to stop them existing at all. Maybe I just need to find the right butterfly to stomp.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_474
text_en: More Void magic. The more I learn about the Void, the more I want to go. Perhaps that's where I belong. Off the edge of the map. Here be dragons. You Tenno have Void in your blood. Lucky bastards.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_475
text_en: All very well for you lot, but what about the rest of us peasants? We can’t all be Tenno, can we?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_476
text_en: What, like you're a hapless little alien waif who's oh so far from home and I'm the scientist obsessed with cutting you up to find out how you work?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_477
text_en: I'm sorry. I was under the impression that we found ONE ANOTHER quite intriguing. I thought these little back-and-forths were our way of getting to know each other.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo4_478
text_en: Don’t be a jerk, Eleanor. Cephalons are people.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_479
text_en: Just imagine. An entire cohort of smarmy dickheads deleted from existence. The only downside is we wouldn’t get to hear them screaming.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo4_480
text_en: I’m just saying I think survival of death is possible.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_481
text_en: But no. Apparently I'm no better than some Zeke fangirl who spends every waking hour thinking about her 'obsession'.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_482
text_en: You're not in Duviri any more, your Majesty. Nobody here gives a shit.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_483
text_en: Get over yourself.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_484
text_en: Stop me if I get this wrong, but… what you’re talking about doesn’t sound like it IS the person. It’s more like a computer that’s been programmed to THINK it’s the person. Correct?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo4_485
text_en: Kind of. Necraloid is a Cephalon copy of Loid, who’s still alive. But even if a Cephalon isn’t the original, they’re still people.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_486
text_en: Although…

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_487
text_en: Crap.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_488
text_en: Yes, yes, I know that’s what you meant. Indulge me.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_489
text_en: The Void could be where souls exist. Is that what we’re saying? That someone crowbarred open the spirit realm and now you lot use it to power half your devices?
