name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_490
text_en: Mmm. Sorry, but that’s not the same thing. We’re not talking about personhood here. We’re talking about continuity.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_491
text_en: If I wiped them out I’d wipe YOU out, wouldn’t I? Because your existence depends on THEIR existence.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo4_492
text_en: Oh just what we need. More people screwing with timelines.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo4_493
text_en: Or you might just create a new branch of history and go off down that.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo4_494
text_en: Not just someone. Entrati. He took the first steps into the Void.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_495
text_en: I should have known that double-dealing bastard had his fingers in this particular pie.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_497
text_en: Has anyone ever met a dead person in the Void? Or has the Void ever taken the form of a dead person? Sorry to ask, but I need to know.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo4_498
text_en: I know some dead people who are like that. The Holdfasts.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_499
text_en: Whoa.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_500
text_en: Don’t get me started. We’ll be here all week if you do.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_501
text_en: I thought this was just a fun conversation.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_502
text_en: We’re still on ‘does the soul survive the death of the body’. We can’t get on to ‘is free will really a thing’ yet.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_503
text_en: Just so we're clear, I don't have any ACTUAL plans to muck about with the future. I just

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_504
text_en: (This is what you get, Eleanor, she told herself. This is where asking the interesting person the Big Important Questions gets you.)

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_505
text_en: You know what? It's not worth it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_506
text_en: I was TRYING to say how much I don't want you to be gone. So much so that I'd be willing to let people in my future go on suffering under the yoke of a bunch of tyrants rather than change a thing.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_507
text_en: Bad taste joke. Sorry. Won't happen again.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo4_508
text_en: If it looks like a sawgaw and it screeches like a sawgaw, it's a sawgaw. It's all the same then, isn't it?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo4_509
text_en: This stuff really matters to you, doesn’t it?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_510
text_en: Hmm. No. I don't think it is.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_511
text_en: Oh, you noticed?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_512
text_en: Excuse me?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_513
text_en: You know some dead people? As in, socially?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_514
text_en: They remember dying? They actually know they’re dead?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo4_515
text_en: Yeah. They used to be officers on the Zariman. The colony ship that got lost in the Void. Now they’re ghosts, I suppose.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo4_516
text_en: It's... complicated. Things can go into the void, but they aren't quite the same when they come out.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_517
text_en: Holy shit, this is incredible.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_518
text_en: Ah. Are you having trouble finding the right words? Or is it that you don't want to tell me the full story? I get nervous when people try to hold back.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_519
text_en: Although…

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_520
text_en: Wait. Don't answer that. Something just flashed across my mind. I don't know if it was a stray thought of yours or not, but dear bleeding Sol on the star-tree it's giving me the horrors.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_521
text_en: How do we know it’s the same person in there? The same point of view?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_522
text_en: Angels.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_523
text_en: What if it’s just, I dunno, a Void Clone or something? Could that happen? The Void taking the IDEA of a person and then giving form to it. And that form then THINKS it’s the same person as the one who died.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_524
text_en: Sweet Lua, I can hear them. Its like... when an air conditioner has been running in the room for so long you've tuned its noise out and then suddenly you notice it

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_525
text_en: Why did I start asking you about this SOL DAMMIT

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_526
text_en: If the Void made a copy of me, I'd end up losing sleep over which of us was the real one.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_527
text_en: Because if it can do that when you're dead, then surely it can do it while you're alive.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_528
text_en: ... I'm not comfortable with where this is heading. Sorry. Talk later. Maybe.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_529
text_en: Yes. It does matter to me.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_530
text_en: More than I’ve really let on, I fear.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_531
text_en: Let’s just say I have reasons for hoping that something of us survives the death of the body. I’m hardly alone in that, I know.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo4_532
text_en: You’re asking the wrong person. I’m not sure I *can* die.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_533
text_en: Right. They tried, didn't they? Thrax made a regular spectacle of you. I don't know how you made it through that nightmare and stayed sane.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_534
text_en: Between you and me, I’m not sure I can die either.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_535
text_en: There’s a committee of tiny Technocytes living inside me now who would be extremely peeved if their home got demolished.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_536
text_en: Which is why they’ve gone to such trouble to make me big and stwong.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_537
text_en: It does make me wonder what would happen if I was killed outright. The Techrot can keep a corpse animated and repurposed. I’ve seen it. Like a colony of termites working in concert to pilot a robot.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_538
text_en: So… would I become some sort of Techrot zombie? If it brought me back, would I still be me? Or would I just be a Techrot hivemind gestalt that had access to my memories, and THOUGHT it was me?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo4_539
text_en: I don’t think it’s healthy for you to be dwelling on this.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_540
text_en: I don’t think I’m healthy, full stop. So there we are.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_541
text_en: But…

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_542
text_en: I appreciate that you care enough to say that.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_543
text_en: Lettie checks up on what my body is doing, because Arthur needs me ready for action. I don’t hate her for that. It’s her job.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_544
text_en: But nobody’s checking up on ME.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_545
text_en: Not until now, anyway.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_546
text_en: Gods, all you’re doing is being kind, and it’s been so bloody long since we were just KIND to one another that I’m making a great big song and dance about it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_547
text_en: Ahem. Thank you. The end.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_548
text_en: Okay. Okay. Right. I am going to focus now. Please stay with me. I am building a wall out of my thoughts. It is rising up between me and the angels.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_549
text_en: Wall wall wall lovely lovely wall

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_550
text_en: There. Wall is in place. All quiet now. I should probably let you go, shouldn't I.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo5_551
text_en: Hey, Eleanor...

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_552
text_en: Hey. What’s on your mind?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo5_553
text_en: Nothing much. [End.]

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_554
text_en: I.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_556
text_en: You -

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_557
text_en: You started this...

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_558
text_en: Perplexing creature...

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo5_559
text_en: You were a ‘journalist’, right? What’s one of those exactly?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_560
text_en: Someone who turns other people’s trauma into cash.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo5_561
text_en: Got it. We call those ‘Corpus’.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_562
text_en: Oh Gods. Sorry. I was being facetious.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_563
text_en: Let me try again.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_564
text_en: A journalist is someone who hunts down interesting things that are happening in the world and tells other people about them, either by writing or making a broadcast of some sort. Usually both.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_565
text_en: A storyteller, I suppose. But not the sort who makes things up.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo5_566
text_en: So what makes a story ‘interesting’?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo5_567
text_en: So you only tell the truth? How do you pick which truths to tell?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_568
text_en: Most of the time, people are interested in reading about the bad things that happen in the world. If it bleeds it leads, as the saying goes.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_569
text_en: I can’t imagine the situation’s any different in your time.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_570
text_en: I tried to make a difference with my work. Yes, I was getting paid for it, but I wanted to do good in the world, too.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_571
text_en: I was younger then, of course. Nothing cures you of the drive to 'do good in the world' than spending some time in it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_572
text_en: This is where it got me. Literally. I only came here to Höllvania in the first place because of the story.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_573
text_en: Sorry. Sidetracked. Need to rant. Are you up for listening to me sound off about a pet hate of mine?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo5_574
text_en: I thought you were here because Arthur was.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo5_575
text_en: Sure, why not.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo5_576
text_en: Honestly, no. [End.]

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_577
text_en: Ok. Don't say I didn't warn you. I have a theory I call the Hero Virus.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_578
text_en: Oh, he was here first. But he made the mistake of telling me what was happening here, and I couldn’t sit on it. So I place a call to my old friend Danny MacIlvoy and pay over the odds for a forged visa and passport. Because I need them in a hurry.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_579
text_en: You have to understand: they were locking Höllvania down, but they couldn’t do it all at once. This may be a walled city-state that’s been here since the time of the Radiant Khan, but the walls they put up to fend her off are old now and the powers in charge couldn’t get barricades and checkpoints up in time.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_580
text_en: Just imagine for a moment that you can have a virus that's transmitted through stories. Like all viruses it wants to take over the host and spread itself further.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_581
text_en: People were falling over themselves to get out. So nobody paid much attention to one stupid Britannic girl who was trying to get in.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_582
text_en: The Hero Virus makes you see the world as if it were a story. It persuades you that Good is all about INDIVIDUAL PEOPLE doing AWESOME THINGS

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_583
text_en: You want to know the worst part?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_584
text_en: So naturally you want to be one of those people

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo5_585
text_en: Tell me the worst part.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo5_586
text_en: Is it going to be gross?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_587
text_en: Oh, and we suddenly become squeamish?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_588
text_en: Pardon me for upsetting your delicate sensibilities. Never mind, then.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_589
text_en: Okay. Here is the worst part.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_590
text_en: I was investigating an outbreak of what was being called Testudo Syndrome. Testudo because it means turtle, and people who had it were developing tough patches on their skin as an early marker. The same sort of thing that eventually turns into armour plating in us lucky few.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_591
text_en: Testudo Syndrome was a treatment-resistant disease that seemed to be exclusive to Höllvania, had some enigmatic and sinister connection to computers, and appeared all at once. And people who asked too many questions about it had a tendency to end up as a clog in a Höllvanian sewer pipe.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_592
text_en: No matter how tough it may be

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_593
text_en: Because a Hero has to make hard decisions. A Hero has to endure pain stoically.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_594
text_en: It's all such cynical bullshit. The Hero Virus exists to sell toys, market movies and to make little boys and girls grow up to be willing cannon fodder

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_595
text_en: They don't make films about the Chosen One whose heroic destiny is to wipe old people's bums in a nursing home

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_596
text_en: Within hours of getting into Höllvania I was picking my way through the sewers and talking Arthur down from the biggest emotional fit he has ever been on.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_597
text_en: I'm almost done, stay with me

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_598
text_en: That boy. You would think I’d followed him here just to piss him off.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_599
text_en: The Hero Virus tricks you into thinking that you can do the most good if there's a spotlight on you. It sets an impossible, twisted example

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo5_600
text_en: Sounds like you didn't take the situation seriously.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo5_601
text_en: Admit it. You did.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo5_602
text_en: No, but it *was* a bonus, wasn't it?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_603
text_en: Arthur thinks he's losing me to the Techrot. But the truth is, I lost him to the Hero Virus a long time ago.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_604
text_en: I bloody did take it seriously.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_605
text_en: Of course I did. But I also had a noble purpose in mind.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_606
text_en: Precisely. But I also had a noble purpose in mind.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_607
text_en: People were trying to kill me. Forgive me for having a sense of humour about it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_608
text_en: ‘Noble.’ Sol’s balls. I really deserved everything that happened to me, didn’t I?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_609
text_en: Maybe you've just been on your own for too long, but in an outfit like this, taking the piss out of one another helps keep us sane.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo5_610
text_en: You were telling me about the worst part.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo5_611
text_en: Sounds like you were just doing your job. What happened next?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_612
text_en: Right, right.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_613
text_en: So I’m in the sewers, and something with a cluster of CRT monitors instead of a head goes lurching past. I’ve barely finished shitting myself when I find the nest.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_614
text_en: I admit, sometimes it gets too close to the bone, especially when Lettie is in one of her depressive slumps and needs someone to hate on

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_615
text_en: But please, for all our sakes, lighten up a bit.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_616
text_en: Even Arthur pops open a beer and puts his feet up, once in a while.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_617
text_en: Growths. Part organic, part technology, part some poor bastard’s delerium tremens. Light in the kind of colours people only see when they’ve inhaled too many solvent fumes. It’s hideous and I can’t take my eyes off it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_618
text_en: Jackpot, I think.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo5_619
text_en: Oh no...

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo5_620
text_en: Tell me you didn't stay there.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_621
text_en: Of course I did.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_622
text_en: I take a dozen grainy pictures on my Kinematic 2300A slip-phone and I send the pictures to Arthur.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_623
text_en: And I say ‘Think I’ve found where this Techrot is coming from.’

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_624
text_en: I filed the story the next day. ‘The Techrot Beneath Höllvanian Streets.’

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo5_625
text_en: You named it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo5_626
text_en: So that's where that came from.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_627
text_en: Ta-da! I named it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_628
text_en: There it is. The worst part.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_629
text_en: Nobody calls it ‘Testudo Syndrome’ now. Nobody calls it the Technocyte. Everyone just calls it Techrot.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_630
text_en: I named the thing that’s eaten this city and is eating me from the bones outward.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo5_631
text_en: Play stupid games, win stupid prizes, I guess?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo5_632
text_en: What’s so bad about that? The name fits.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_633
text_en: Sorry. For some reason I thought you'd understand. Or at least sympathize.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_634
text_en: You're right, though. It IS all a stupid game, isn't it

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_635
text_en: We're all just a bunch of decaying clowns trapped on a carousel that never stops

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_636
text_en: Roll up roll up see the amazing gorgon lady, one of a kind, don't let your child come too close madam, she's not been fed today

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_637
text_en: Talk whenever.  Need a drink.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_638
text_en: Nobody talks about the work I did on Minister Jeremy Coniston and the bogus famine relief, or the Lazlo Fertilizer scandal, or any of that. It barely made a ripple.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_639
text_en: And now I come up with a term that everyone uses and nobody even knows I came up with it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_640
text_en: ‘Techrot’

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_641
text_en: They can put that word on my bloody tombstone.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo5_642
text_en: If I get one.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorBirthdayConvo3_2325
text_en: Thanks for reminding me that I haven’t had a birthday cake in years. Truly thoughtful.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo6_645
text_en: He's a charming little imp. Why are you asking?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo6_646
text_en: As much as the next person, I suppose. Why are you asking?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo6_647
text_en: Amir's trying to get the team together to play a game of Fables & Frontiers, and I said I'd help.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo6_648
text_en: Amir really wants to play Fables & Frontiers with everybody. You in?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo6_649
text_en: Ah. I see. You are the chosen messenger, sent from the Thunderbolt King to enlist fair Eleanor. No doubt all sorts of roguery await me. Fol de rol and so forth.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo6_650
text_en: Yeah, I think it's going to be a total waste of time, but I'm trying to be nice.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo6_651
text_en: I think it'll be fun, honestly. And it seems to mean a lot to him.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo6_652
text_en: I will do you a favour and NOT convey those words along to him. Word to the wise: treat him with more respect in the future in my presence.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo6_653
text_en: Honestly, putting on a daft voice and play-acting for a few hours sounds ideal. Count me in.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo6_654
text_en: Oh! I would like to be a wizard. Or perhaps a bard. Or perhaps both? Can you BE both?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo6_655
text_en: Or I could be a swamp hag! So long as I get to wear a tight bodice, mind. Mother Mossytits will eat your bones, little manikin.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank6Convo1_2251
text_en: Yours in eager anticipation, E. xxx

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_656
text_en: I could get Amir to reprogram a Chattin’ Charlotte doll with some choice Eleanor phrases, and he could scare Lettie with it after I was dead, but it wouldn’t be ME.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank2Convo4_657
text_en: Unless I could possess it somehow. Let me go and ponder that.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo1_658
text_en: Hey, Eleanor, is it okay to ask you about the telepathy thing?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo1_659
text_en: So, what's it like being able to peek into everybody's heads?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_660
text_en: It’s always okay to ask, so long as you ask politely.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_661
text_en: Some people find that very difficult.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_662
text_en: Excuse me?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_663
text_en: Is that what you imagine I do? Casually violate other people's privacy?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_664
text_en: If that's what you think of me, then I doubt we have much to talk about.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo1_665
text_en: Do you hear people’s thoughts without trying? Or do you always have to make an effort to get inside their head?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo1_666
text_en: Is it like a light switch? Or is it always "stuck on?"

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_667
text_en: Yes to both. If I just sit and ‘listen’, I can pick up on internal monologues and strong feelings.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_668
text_en: The hardest part is filtering out the LOUD stuff I don’t want to know about.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_669
text_en: I don’t always get to experience feelings as if they were someone else’s. The more pre-verbal it is, the harder it is to discern between ‘them’ and ‘me’.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_670
text_en: Permission to delve into the realms of ‘too much information’?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo1_671
text_en: Well I'm too curious to say no, now...

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo1_672
text_en: Permission granted.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo1_673
text_en: Eh... another time, maybe. [End.]

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_674
text_en: I salute your bravery.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_675
text_en: Read further at your own risk.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_676
text_en: Not long after we all got the Entrati shots, I thought I had some kind of secondary bladder infection. Mate. I was up and down off that couch like a yo-yo. I even had Lettie hunting me down cranberry juice and mineral water.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_677
text_en: Turns out I was just feeling six people’s natural biological urges. My nervous system naturally assumed they were mine.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo1_678
text_en: Which was worse? Learning you weren't catastrophically sick or...

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo1_679
text_en: Must have been a relief to find out the truth.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_680
text_en: Well, I AM catastrophically sick. Let's not mince words. But I'd rather be saddled with telepathy than never-ending cystitis.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_681
text_en: I learned to build walls around my mind after that incident. Lettie sometimes finds meds that can shut the whole telepathic side of me down, just for a few hours. I have a stash of them, but I don’t take them unless I really, really need to sleep.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_682
text_en: It’s such a useful talent to have, that’s the problem. Arthur insists on seeing it as a strategic asset.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo1_683
text_en: What about people’s privacy? Isn’t it bad for morale?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo1_684
text_en: But what if somebody *doesn't* want their head invaded?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_685
text_en: It’s bloody awful for morale.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_686
text_en: Even if I insist that I can control it, do you think they would believe me?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_687
text_en: None of us is soft. We’re used to roughing it. This place is a five star hotel compared to a regular Britannic army barracks.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_688
text_en: You shower together, you eat together, et cetera. You get used to one another. You have to.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_689
text_en: But as Arthur would say, there’s a sodding limit.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo1_690
text_en: So how do you deal with it?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_691
text_en: I just don’t let them know how much of their inner lives I hear, see and feel. I don’t go probing uninvited, whatever Lettie might think.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_692
text_en: Sometimes one of them will have a thought, and immediately think ‘did she hear me thinking that?' It's kinder to let them wonder. What they don’t know can’t hurt them.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo1_693
text_en: Have you overheard any of MY thoughts?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo1_694
text_en: So... what've you picked up in my head?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_695
text_en: Like I said, I’m not about to confirm or deny anything.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_696
text_en: I should say, right about now, that there’s another important reason why I keep this shit to myself.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_697
text_en: So. Arthur and me. We’re on the streets, raiding a Scaldra cache, and he’s seriously off his game. He’s not shooting straight, he’s driving like a drunk duck at the dodgems, he can’t even do the sword thing.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo1_698
text_en: Go on…

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_699
text_en: Naturally, I tell him to get his act together. Immediately he starts blaming ME. He tells me I’m always acting so superior, don’t I understand the pressure of command, if I had the first idea what he has to deal with on a DAILY basis I’d buckle, all this self-pitying bollocks.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_700
text_en: Remember the Hero Virus I told you about?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_701
text_en: I have this theory I call the Hero Virus.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_702
text_en: Terminal case.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_703
text_en: Everything was about Arthur.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_704
text_en: Little boys get it into their heads that the stories they've been fed are how the world really works. They think they are the hero and everything revolves around them.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_705
text_en: Arthur has one of the worst cases of Hero Virus I've ever seen.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_706
text_en: So I fire back at him ‘you know I can tell when you’re thinking about Aoi, right?’

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo1_707
text_en: Ouch.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_708
text_en: Yeah.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_709
text_en: Not my proudest moment.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_710
text_en: Even if he hadn’t been my brother, that was a shitty thing to do. I’ll never do it again.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo1_711
text_en: How did he react?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_712
text_en: … I don’t like that you want to know.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_713
text_en: Now I’m wondering whether you’re enjoying the idea of Arthur being humiliated.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_714
text_en: Please don’t let that be it. I’m starting to like you, and this is the sort of thing I wouldn’t be able to look past.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo1_715
text_en: I’m asking because I like the guy.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo1_716
text_en: Yikes. That wasn't my intention. I just wanted to know how someone like that reacts to being confronted.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo1_717
text_en: I am enjoying it. Sounds like Arthur had it coming.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_718
text_en: Okay. That’s understandable. I’m sorry I snapped.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_719
text_en: He crumpled. I felt horrible.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_720
text_en: I didn't just confront him. I HURT him.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_721
text_en: Arthur's used to being talked back to. Just look at Quincy!

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_722
text_en: Oh, I get it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_723
text_en: Arthur's a pain in the arse.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_724
text_en: I’d broken something important between us. Hang on. I need to tell you something so you’ll understand.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_725
text_en: But we all know Arthur's got walls up. He acts like he's impossible to hurt.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_726
text_en: But when I'm trying to talk to you about something I feel guilty about...

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_727
text_en: Never mind.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_728
text_en: I could feel how shocked and confused he was. He'd thought he was safe around me. Not anymore.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_729
text_en: When we were little, some older boys stole Arthur’s favourite Action Angus and threw him on the Solstice bonfire.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_730
text_en: I can still see him bent over and the flesh coloured plastic bubbling and dripping all over his camo trousers.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo1_731
text_en: I don't miss being a kid.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo1_732
text_en: Yay, childhood.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_733
text_en: The boys laughed and said Arthur should be happy. Action Angus was going to the Hall of Heroes for the midwinter feast like warriors used to. I wanted to murder them. Little bastards.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_734
text_en: Arthur didn’t want the boys to see him cry, and he didn’t want to cry in front of my dad, so the only person left was me. His shitty big sister.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_735
text_en: I’m telling you about that because that’s where Arthur went, in his head. He remembered feeling like it was safe to cry in front of me if he ever really NEEDED to, and now?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_736
text_en: Now it wasn’t safe any more.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo1_737
text_en: I  know what it's like to hurt a sibling. I... used to have one.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo1_738
text_en: Sounds like you hurt him badly.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_739
text_en: It's horrible, isn't it? You get so used to the ritual of it, putting one another down, sniping and snarking...

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_740
text_en: It's comforting, almost. Then one day you draw blood and you can't take it back.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_741
text_en: Yeah, I did. I apologized, I promised I’d never do anything like that again, but I still feel like shit because of it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo1_742
text_en: It’s fighting dirty.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_743
text_en: YES.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_744
text_en: You GET IT. I love that! Fighting dirty.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_745
text_en: You know that thing where you’re in an argument with someone and once it’s all over, you think of the exact right thing you should have said?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_746
text_en: I don’t get that any more. I have a magic I Win button. All I’d have to do is look into their brain, grab whatever they’re most ashamed of and rub it in their face.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_747
text_en: And I CAN’T DO IT, no matter how much I want to. Because I’m supposed to be a ‘good person’.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo1_748
text_en: This isn’t about trying to be a saint, Eleanor. It’s not even about being a hero. It’s about refusing to be an asshole.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo1_749
text_en: We're all trying to do the right thing here. Is it really that much harder for you?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo1_750
text_en: We all have lines we won’t cross and this is one of yours. I respect that.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_751
text_en: Oh dear. That's what I get for parading my virtues, isn't it?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_752
text_en: Sorry. I was expecting sympathy. But I'll take the reality check.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_753
text_en: Thank you.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_754
text_en: I’m not looking for sympathy. Truly.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_755
text_en: It's not like I'm the only one who has to keep her powers in check, is it? We're all time bombs waiting to go off.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_756
text_en: I just wanted someone else to understand. Honestly, I’m a little taken aback by how much you DO understand.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_757
text_en: You didn’t have to listen. But I’m glad you did.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_758
text_en: It’s a messed-up freakshow inside this skull of mine. I think you can appreciate why I don’t roll out the welcome mat to strangers.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_759
text_en: I expect people to run away screaming. You haven’t. Yet. I wonder why. Thank you. Again. For everything.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo1_760
text_en: Appreciate the talk.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_761
text_en: Are you there? I need to talk.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_762
text_en: Are you there? I need to talk to you about something. It’s serious.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo2_763
text_en: Right here.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo2_764
text_en: Really sorry. Not right now. [End.]

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo2_765
text_en: I’m here. Go ahead.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_766
text_en: Remember how I told you about how I tried to touch Rusalka’s mind with mine, and I made contact with The Indifference instead?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_767
text_en: Thank you.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_768
text_en: Do you understand what happened to Major Rusalka?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo2_769
text_en: Of course I remember.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo2_770
text_en: She was being used. The Indifference was puppeting her.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo2_771
text_en: Pretty sure she was hollowed out and driven around like a... well... Warframe...?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_772
text_en: Right. I wasn’t ready to talk about it then. I’m ready now, if you’re willing.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_773
text_en: ‘The Indifference’. That’s what you call it?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_774
text_en: Hollowed out, yes.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_852
text_en: Thank you.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_775
text_en: But whatever was driving her wasn't like you.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_853
text_en: Giving it a name feels like I’ve gotten a tiny bit of control back.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_776
text_en: Anything human about it was like a mockery.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo2_777
text_en: If you’re sure.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_778
text_en: I’m sure.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_779
text_en: This creature, this presence, is what we’re ultimately up against. I know that much now.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_854
text_en: I’ve touched that thing with my mind. I thought I’d be probing Rusalka’s mind, but… the outer layers just caved in like wet, spongy plasterboard and then I was immersed in it. Floundering.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_780
text_en: It was about as human as a store mannequin. In pieces.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_781
text_en: Please tell me the truth. Do you believe there is any hope?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_782
text_en: I touched it, you see. With my mind. I was trying to probe her, but she wasn't there.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo2_783
text_en: I know what you mean. We call it The Indifference.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_784
text_en: Thank you.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_785
text_en: Giving it a name feels like I’ve gotten a tiny bit of control back.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo2_786
text_en: At this point? ... No.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo2_787
text_en: Honestly? I'm... not sure.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo2_788
text_en: Yes, I do.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_789
text_en: At least you were honest.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_790
text_en: I understand.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_791
text_en: Don’t tell me why.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_792
text_en: Fine. Let hope die.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_793
text_en: There's so much we don't know.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_794
text_en: Just hold on to that belief. Let me feel it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_795
text_en: I'll keep fighting out of pure bloody stubbornness.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_796
text_en: After what's already happened this year, how are we supposed to make sane plans ever again?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_797
text_en: Please.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_798
text_en: Hate. Rage. Anything.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_799
text_en: Maybe hope is a delusion. I don't know.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_800
text_en: I reached out for Rusalka, and it was as if my fingers touched her face and went right through. The mask just collapsed.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_801
text_en: I’ve touched that thing with my mind. I thought I’d be probing Rusalka’s mind, but… the outer layers just caved in like wet, spongy plasterboard and then I was immersed in it. Floundering.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_802
text_en: Better than apathy. Better than meek surrender.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_803
text_en: I could just really do with some right now.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_804
text_en: What was underneath was like…

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_805
text_en: There’s a word. ‘Calenture.’ It’s a kind of madness that used to affect sailors. They’d become convinced that the green sea all around them wasn’t water at all, but green grass.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_806
text_en: Ah, well. So it is. Even if we're stumbling onward through the dark, at least we have one another's company.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_807
text_en: I'm ready.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_808
text_en: They'd be compelled to jump from the ship down into the beautiful green meadows and go running across them. If a shipmate held them back, they’d fight.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_809
text_en: I jumped, expecting grass. Next second I was in over my head in the freezing dark.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo2_810
text_en: I don't think it's safe for you to talk about it like this.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_811
text_en: Well, shit.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo2_812
text_en: I’m here. Go on.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_813
text_en: There’s a feeling there isn’t a word for. You look out on the world and you just KNOW, that all the ordinariness - buildings, cars, people, jobs, work, routine - is just a thin crust over a bottomless horror, and if people ever realized it they’d start screaming and never stop.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_814
text_en: I'd just about managed to psych myself up to this, and now, what? we're not mentioning the Devil in case it summons him?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_815
text_en: I fell through the crust.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_816
text_en: If you hear screaming in the night, it's me.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_817
text_en: It wasn’t emptiness. I could have borne that. It went on and on forever, but it wasn’t just cold space. There was something in there with me.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo2_818
text_en: An eye?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo2_819
text_en: A man trapped in a wall?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo2_820
text_en: What was it?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_821
text_en: I don’t know. But it knew I was there. It was AWARE of me. Like an elephant would be aware of a fly crawling across its eye.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_822
text_en: I remember thinking ‘nothing that big should know I exist’.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_823
text_en: It felt such utter disregard for me, such monumental indifference that I wanted to stop existing on the spot.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo2_824
text_en: It... does that.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo2_825
text_en: What did you do?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_826
text_en: I think I could have coped if it had hated me. Then I would have had some value, some significance. But it saw me as meaningless, and I saw what it saw. I was a speck. A nothing.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_827
text_en: Everything I had ever been, every tender moment, every laugh, every morsel of Eleanor Nightingale blew away in that storm.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_828
text_en: It felt my light fading, and I swear, a tiny tremor of satisfaction went through it. As if it was pleased to have crushed me. A flea under its fingernail.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo2_829
text_en: But you came back, didn’t you? You’re still here. You proved that thing wrong.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_830
text_en: Did I?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_831
text_en: It’s still out there, isn’t it?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo2_832
text_en: Yes, it is. But you’re still here, too.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo2_833
text_en: The stars don’t stop burning just because space is big, cold and dark.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_834
text_en: But they will stop burning. One day. The heat death of the Universe.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_835
text_en: Indifference wins in the end, my friend, no matter how many platitudes we throw into the abyss.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_836
text_en: That’s the problem with not going mad. You’re cursed with clarity of thought.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_837
text_en: You know what I’m talking about. You could have shattered like a sparrow’s egg or burnt your brain out with drugs until you felt nothing any more. And it would have hurt less than this… knowing.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_838
text_en: I don’t understand why you haven’t walked away from this conversation yet.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo2_839
text_en: Look. Entropy is real. I get that. Maybe the Great Indifference is the same thing. But whether it wins in the end, you don’t know and I don’t know either.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo2_840
text_en: I'm waiting for you to make up your mind, honestly. Do you want to take the easy way out and go insane? Or do you want to stand and fight?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo2_841
text_en: What I do know is that I’m not going to let it win NOW.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_842
text_en: FIGHT HOW

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_843
text_en: IS THAT ALL YOU AND ARTHUR CAN UNDERSTAND? FIGHTING?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_844
text_en: So you’re putting up with my wails of existential despair as a battle tactic? That’s very Arthur of you.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo2_845
text_en: Actually, believe it or not, I care about you.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_846
text_en: YOUR ANSWER TO THE UNDERLYING MEANINGLESSNESS OF EXISTENCE IS 'FIND A WAY TO PUNCH IT?'

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_847
text_en: I can't believe I thought we had a single thing in common.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_848
text_en: More fool me.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_849
text_en: I care about you too, mate. We’re squadmates. We've been through a lot.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_850
text_en: It’s only fair to warn you that the good ship Eleanor may go down, either in the bloody sea or the night-black swamp, and you do not want to be on board when she does.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo2_851
text_en: Thanks. You should go. I’ll be okay now. Honestly.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo3_855
text_en: Hey, Eleanor. How are you doing?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_856
text_en: Spiffing. Just been shaving my tongue.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo3_857
text_en: Shaving?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo3_858
text_en: Hold up. *What?*

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_859
text_en: Shaving. These nobbly bits keep sprouting out of it. I think they used to be taste buds. If I don’t slice them off, they get really long and squirmy. Like a sea anemone.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_860
text_en: It's really no different from trimming one's nails.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_861
text_en: Sorry. I really should have warned you about this.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_862
text_en: Messier, perhaps. But still nothing more than the paring back of an unwanted excrescence.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_863
text_en: Everybody else knows to be at least a hundred yards away when Eleanor heads into the bathrooms with a kitchen knife and a bottle of surgical alcohol.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_864
text_en: Just wait patiently and eventually I’ll come back out with blood all down my chin and a plastic bag of stuff like crab meat in my hand. I tried to turn the offcuts into burgers once but nobody wanted any.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_865
text_en: Sorry, did you want the half hour erotic chat experience or just the five minutes?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo3_866
text_en: Stop trying to gross me out.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo3_867
text_en: So, while we're talking about the tongue...

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_868
text_en: Oi. I’m the one with half an eel down my trachea. Pardon me for trying to joke about it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_869
text_en: Go on.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo3_870
text_en: ... how much control have you got over it?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_871
text_en: Right. Wait a moment.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_872
text_en: thids much

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_873
text_en: howm i dioing

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo3_874
text_en: Tell me you're not.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo3_875
text_en: Oh, hell no. I'm out. [End.]

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_876
text_en: o but i amm hheehhe

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo3_877
text_en: Pardon me if this is too personal but... what *else* can you do with it...?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo3_878
text_en: You’re typing with it?!

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_879
text_en: welll

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_880
text_en: mmm

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_881
text_en: thnk abot what you wld do

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_882
text_en: me too

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_883
text_en: feels gooood hehe

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo3_884
text_en: I. Heh. Well, then. I guess my next question would be... do you ever lose control of it?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_885
text_en: But not for long though because I get saliva all over the keyboard.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_886
text_en: Anyway. Now you know.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo3_887
text_en: Do you ever lose control of it?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo3_888
text_en: Do you ever bite it by accident?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_889
text_en: Damnnable thing does seem to have a mind of its own. When I think about it, I can control it. But when I'm not, it seems to react to my emotions.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_890
text_en: All the time. It heals fast.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_891
text_en: The more horrid possibility is that its driven not by ME but by my latent connection to the Techrot. I'd rather not consider that option.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_892
text_en: I do hate it when it gets in the way of my teeth, however. The one and only time I ever bit it off completely, it grew back. I'm stuck with this thing.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_893
text_en: The one and only time I ever bit it off completely, it grew back. I’m stuck with this thing.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_894
text_en: At least it’s not getting any longer. Just putting out frondy bits.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo3_895
text_en: Would you want to go back to the way you used to be before Entrati changed you?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo3_896
text_en: How do you feel about it? Like... really feel about it?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_897
text_en: I mean, yes? In a heartbeat. But I can’t, so what’s the point of dwelling on it?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_898
text_en: I wouldn't have chosen it. But I don't hate it. It feels like it's always been there.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo3_899
text_en: Everything that happens to us happens for a reason.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_900
text_en: I miss the sound of my own voice. I hate that I can't sing any more.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_901
text_en: But the tongue? You might find this hard to believe, but it's comforting sometimes. I'll never be unarmed ever again.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_902
text_en: Yeah. It’s just that sometimes the reason is: an evil bastard did something evil.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_903
text_en: So if you’re saying that everything always works out for the best, like there’s some great plan or purpose to it all, then you’re on your own. I don’t buy into that.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_904
text_en: It’s hero virus stuff. You end up thinking you’re the main character in everyone else’s story.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_905
text_en: There’s no great story here, mate. No author in the sky adding little plot beats to my life for dramatic effect.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_906
text_en: I get to make meaning out of the stupid shit that happens to me. I’m the artist, not Sol or Lua or any of the stars in between.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_907
text_en: You reminded me of that. I don’t know if you even remember. I was feeling sorry for myself and you snapped me out of it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo3_908
text_en: Glad I could help.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo3_909
text_en: You’re not saying that life is meaningless, are you?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_910
text_en: Gods, no. I’m saying that meaning is under the surface and it takes a sculptor’s chisel to get to it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_911
text_en: Some days it all feels bleak, horrible and hollow and I don’t want to get off the couch. But when I’m back to myself again, I know that feeling was a lie.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_912
text_en: Nobody else holds the keys to meaning, you know? It’s a jam session between you and the universe. She throws stuff at you, you improvise around it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_913
text_en: It helps to focus on the parts of being semi-infested that I really like.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo3_914
text_en: So… what do you like most about being like you are now?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo3_915
text_en: I'm glad at least ONE of you is trying to find a silver lining...

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_916
text_en: Feeling indestructible.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_917
text_en: Only one? Have you MET Amir?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_918
text_en: He has his dark moments, but that boy is an inspiration to us all.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_919
text_en: Compared to mooching about with a face like a slapped arse, I'll take Amir's attitude any day.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_920
text_en: Mind if I tell you a story?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo3_921
text_en: Go ahead.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_922
text_en: When I was eighteen, a whole bunch of us had been out celebrating the end of the exams. We were all packed into this tiny car. Me lying across three people’s laps on the back seat.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_923
text_en: Seb Cromley in the boot, whingeing. Christopher and Marco in the front. Every one of us was drunk off our arse on strawberry vodka and ratcatcher.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_924
text_en: Marco ran a red light, a car coming the other way T-boned us, we rolled off the road and ended up in a ditch. I only know that because that’s what the policeman told me had happened.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_925
text_en: They had to cut me out of the car. I wouldn’t stop screaming. It was the kind of hurt that leaves you with no crevice anywhere in yourself to crawl into to get away from it. You're being punished for existing.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_926
text_en: I was helpless as a baby rabbit. Melted like a crayon. Gone. Just lay there and belted out scream after scream. I’d always thought of myself as a tough cookie before that.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo3_927
text_en: I know the kind of pain you mean.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_928
text_en: Two days ago I was run over by a Scaldra APC.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_929
text_en: That same old pain went flooding through me, but it wasn’t crippling any more. It was like fuel, revving me up, making me angry.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_930
text_en: I picked myself up, relocated my shoulder and tore that APC open with my bare hands.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_931
text_en: Agonizing, yes. But intoxicating.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo3_932
text_en: So yeah, thanks for that much, Entrati. Wherever you are.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_933
text_en: So stop me if I get any of this wrong:

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_934
text_en: You’ve got another self out there, walking around. That other self both is and isn’t you. They’re like a kid version of you from another version of reality.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo4_935
text_en: Not quite. This is their version of reality. I’m the outsider here.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo4_936
text_en: More like we split at some point, I took a left turn, they went right.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_937
text_en: Whoa Nelly. Hang on. Let me process that.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_938
text_en: And I take it we are in THEIR reality, not yours. Let me... process that.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_939
text_en: So… you’re like a guest star from a crossover episode and you got written into the show?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo4_940
text_en: Pretty much.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_941
text_en: This is making my head spin. So what happened to your version of reality? Where’s it gone?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo4_942
text_en: I think the only thing left of it is the ghost ship Zariman plugging a hole between dimensions...?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo4_943
text_en: I think whatever was left of it came with me into Duviri. For...better or worse.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo4_944
text_en: I don’t dwell on that much. I guess it’s lost.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_945
text_en: Then it lives on, in some sense.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_946
text_en: You can’t just LOSE a whole cosmos. That’s insane. It has to be out there somewhere.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_947
text_en: Ah! The lair of your friendly ghosts. The Holdfasts.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_948
text_en: I'm sorry, that sounds fascinating but I have no idea what you're on about.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_949
text_en: I can't imagine it's the kind of place you'd want to pop back to for a nostalgic stroll.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_950
text_en: Ghost ship?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_951
text_en: I can't begin to fathom what you've lost.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_952
text_en: Hole between dimensions?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_953
text_en: I don't know if that's any kind of a comfort.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo4_954
text_en: It might be. Like I said, not my major concern.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo4_955
text_en: I've learned that home, and family, is more about what you make of the "where" and the "who" around you.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_956
text_en: But that’s your HOME. Don’t you want to get back there?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo4_957
text_en: Less about where and what you're born into.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo4_958
text_en: It’s really not, not anymore. I don’t really have a home.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo4_959
text_en: I don't see it that way.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo4_960
text_en: The Zariman was the colony ship I was on. Headed for Tau. Never made it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo4_961
text_en: I made it out. I survived. How insanely lucky is that?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo4_962
text_en: She ended up in the Void, and something that existed there decided to turn the ship into a vision of hell.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo4_963
text_en: Honestly, the odds of any one of us actually existing in the first place are so slim, it's just one more miracle to me.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo4_964
text_en: She's been washing back and forth from the Void to reality, and now she's stuck on the threshold.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo4_965
text_en: I don't focus on what was lost. I focus on what I still have. Like this place. Like all of you. Because...

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo4_966
text_en: The ‘Drifter’ nickname stuck for a reason, you know.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo4_967
text_en: Of all the places I’ve been, this feels most like where I belong.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo4_968
text_en: Don't focus on what was lost. Cherish what we've got.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo4_969
text_en: She's not really one ship, either. She's like... lots of different versions at once.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_970
text_en: I can't imagine it's the kind of place you'd want to pop back to for a nostalgic stroll.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_971
text_en: I can't begin to fathom what you've lost.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo4_972
text_en: I don't see it that way.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo4_973
text_en: I have this place, now. The first place I've ever really had that feels like home.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo4_974
text_en: I made it out. I survived. How insanely lucky is that?
