name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo4_975
text_en: Honestly, the odds of any one of us actually existing in the first place are so slim, it's just one more miracle to me.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo4_976
text_en: Don't focus on what was lost. Cherish what we've got.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo4_977
text_en: For example? I have this place now. And all of you. It's the first place I've ever really had that feels like home.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_978
text_en: Huh. I’m oddly proud of that.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_979
text_en: Maybe you just needed the right bunch of lethally stylish urban bio-commandos to associate with.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo4_980
text_en: Misfits and screwups like me?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_981
text_en: And proud of it, mate.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_982
text_en: But getting back to the other version of you…

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo4_983
text_en: Right. Ordis calls them ‘the Operator’. Lotus calls them her child. Mostly I just call them the kid.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo4_984
text_en: I try to avoid them as much as I can. I don't get paid enough to babysit, even if it is just me.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_985
text_en: Ooh. Harsh.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_986
text_en: Given how much you have in common, you might be a little kinder.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_987
text_en: I love that she has children. Lethal space children.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_988
text_en: I wonder if she'd let me be one? Do I get to be a Tenno?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_989
text_en: No. I don't suppose I would, would I? I'm too old, for a start.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_990
text_en: So here’s the part I don’t understand.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_991
text_en: The kid is umpty-billion years old, but they spent most of that time in a freezer, so they’re still a kid, right?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo4_992
text_en: Something like that.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo4_993
text_en: Not sure how "childlike" they really are when they've been trained to murder for a living.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_994
text_en: Okay.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_995
text_en: A. Child. Is. A Child.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_996
text_en: Bear with me.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_997
text_en: They don't conveniently turn into something else when they're mistreated.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_998
text_en: Stop me immediately if this isn’t something you want to talk about.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_999
text_en: The Zariman? What happened with your parents? This child has been through the same horrific ordeal you went through, right?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo4_1000
text_en: Yes.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo4_1001
text_en: You have to understand there was only the one of me, of us, at first. We were exactly the same person, right up to the moment where I shook that thing’s hand. That’s when they went their way and I went mine.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_1002
text_en: Okay. My head hurts thinking about it, but okay.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_1003
text_en: So there’s a child. A profoundly traumatized child. And someone thought it was a good idea to give this child weapons and armour and a selection of battle suits made from dead people, train them to kill, and send them off to war?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo4_1004
text_en: Yup. That was the Orokin.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_1005
text_en: Tell me, after everything they’ve been through and are still going through, how is that child not catatonic in a hospital?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo4_1006
text_en: Honestly, I couldn’t tell you. I know they’ve got people who love them and look out for them. Ordis and Lotus, mainly.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo4_1007
text_en: Void knows they’ve seen way more violence and bloodshed than any kid ever should. They never signed up for this shit, either.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo4_1008
text_en: The Tenno didn’t get a choice about being made into warriors. The Orokin were going to kill every one of them before they found a use for them.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo4_1009
text_en: But what keeps them going inside? I don’t think that’s something they were trained to do. It’s something about who they are.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_1010
text_en: Caring? Empathy?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo4_1011
text_en: Justice. Righteousness.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo4_1012
text_en: Something deeper, maybe.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo4_1013
text_en: Survival instincts. People want to live, at the end of the day.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_1014
text_en: Of course. The Hero Virus. I should have known it would survive to your time.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_1015
text_en: Ugh. The Hero Virus.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_1016
text_en: Those poor kids were steeped in a myth, weren't they?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_1017
text_en: That's what I call the cycle of bullshit that starts with pretty stories and ends with young people willingly going to their deaths.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_1018
text_en: Trained to believe they were honourable warriors, not innocent catspaws?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_1019
text_en: No need to answer. I think I already know.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_1020
text_en: Arthur has it. Christopher had it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_1021
text_en: Maybe I can develop a vaccine and save history.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_1022
text_en: Whatever the opposite of Indifference is, perhaps.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_1023
text_en: I wonder…

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo4_1024
text_en: What?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_1025
text_en: Nothing. Just an idea.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_1026
text_en: This is going to sound stupid, but please promise me something.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_1027
text_en: I know you’ve found a place here with us. I’m glad about that, truly.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_1028
text_en: All I ask is that you check on the child, if you can.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_1029
text_en: Hmm. I don't know.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_1030
text_en: They'd be no different to the Techrot if all they wanted to do was survive.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_1031
text_en: The way you talk about the kid, I'm not sure if I'm more scared for them or of them.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_1032
text_en: I think there's mercy in there, though. Some deep compassion. Maybe one day I'll see it for myself.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo4_1033
text_en: The child is fine, honestly. Lotus is with them. So’s Loid. They’re not about to break down.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo4_1034
text_en: Don’t underestimate them, Eleanor. They did just fine without me for years.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo4_1035
text_en: Don’t worry. I’m already doing that. I’ll tell them you said hello, if you like.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_1036
text_en: Okay. I just hope you're sure.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_1037
text_en: Because whatever they have inside them that can endure everything they went through and still feel empathy? We're going to need it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_1038
text_en: I'm not sure that slaughtering thousands while carrying untold trauma is 'doing fine', frankly.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_1039
text_en: I'd want to know how they were coping.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_1040
text_en: Thank you. I admit, the idea of talking to an alternate version of yourself is exciting to me.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_1041
text_en: In fact, learning of your alternate version convinced me there must be another me out there somewhere who decided to become a nun. An apostle of Lua, shaven head, regular prayers, all of that.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_1042
text_en: I’ve been trying to make contact with her telepathically. If you can do it so can I, right?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo4_1043
text_en: I’m not sure that’s such a great idea.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo4_1044
text_en: Have you gotten anywhere?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_1045
text_en: Don't be such a spoilsport.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_1046
text_en: No. But I’m going to keep trying.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo4_1047
text_en: I mean if anyone’s going to have words of wisdom for me it’ll be the me who’s been devoting her life to spiritual things, no?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo4_1048
text_en: Let’s hope so.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo4_1049
text_en: If you're sure...

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo5_1050
text_en: Hello, Drifter. I’m upset.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo5_1051
text_en: Hi, upset. I’m Drifter.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo5_1052
text_en: Don’t have time right now, sorry. [End.]

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo5_1053
text_en: What’s upsetting you?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo5_1054
text_en: Two things.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo5_2254
text_en: THEY HAVE DAD JOKES IN THE FUTURE

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo5_2255
text_en: Happy now. Thank you.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo5_1055
text_en: I miss wine. I’ve not had real wine in so bloody long. All the wine in Höllvania got requisitioned by Scaldra command a few days into the outbreak.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo5_1056
text_en: Quincy and Arthur tried making prison hooch out of fruit ration sachets, but those of us who still had some dignity left said no. Rare moment of Lettie solidarity, that was.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo5_1057
text_en: The other thing, the much much bigger thing, is the future.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo5_1058
text_en: It’s not your fault, but… now that I’ve seen the future through your eyes I feel miserable in a way that the usual methods won’t shift.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo5_1059
text_en: What can I do to cheer you up?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo5_1060
text_en: Usual methods?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo5_1061
text_en: I don't know. Maybe an exotic dance?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo5_1062
text_en: Spending the evening with Amir listening to him enthuse about whatever comic series or retro game he’s currently fixating on.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo5_1063
text_en: Describe Ballas's death to me in loving detail?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo5_1064
text_en: Surrounding myself with crystals and mentally chanting until Lettie calls the exorcist on me.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo5_1065
text_en: It's kind of you to offer, but I think this melancholy will just have to be borne.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo5_1066
text_en: This is a different kind of sad. It’s weighing me down like a soggy blanket.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo5_2256
text_en: Maybe I'll paint.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo5_1067
text_en: 1999 Höllvania is rough! Scaldra, Techrot, Void knows what else. Does the future really look that much worse?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo5_1068
text_en: Oh, come on... you're tough. You can deal with this. There's so much cool stuff here.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo5_1069
text_en: Look, I was never really into science fiction. Arthur went through a phase, but he always preferred the gritty army stuff. Manly men being heroes, wholesome Stories for Boys, oodles of subtext, I’m sure you know the sort of thing.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo5_1070
text_en: Fine. Take me by the hand and walk me through the streets of Höllvania.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo5_1071
text_en: But I did know enough about science fiction to know that in the far far future, we are supposed to have our shit together. It’s meant to be all shiny and antiseptic. Robots do all the hard work, there’s no disease, nobody needs money, it’s all silver towers, blue skies and sexy lizards.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo5_1072
text_en: I know a place where we can grab some grated turnip cakes and watch the sun go down over the remains of a school.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo5_1073
text_en: Later we can sip cocktails by the light of a burning tank.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo5_1074
text_en: We have robots. They do do a lot of the hard work.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo5_1075
text_en: But what you’re talking about is just fiction, right? So why would you expect reality to live up to it?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo5_1076
text_en: Well, all right. You get a point for that.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo5_1077
text_en: Ugh. I don’t… it’s complicated. Let me explain.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo5_1078
text_en: But did those robots make life any easier for ordinary people?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo5_1079
text_en: I’m not saying I expected the future to look like a children’s comic book. I just mean there was this optimism associated with it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo5_1080
text_en: I think we all just took it for granted that however shitty things might be right now, we’d sort it out eventually. Our civilization is meant to progress. We started out smashing each other over the head with clubs and after a few thousand years we’d figured out ways to sort our differences out without doing that.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo5_1081
text_en: Or did they just become something else to take for granted?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo5_1082
text_en: People are still people, however much technology changes.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo5_1083
text_en: I'm sorry we let you down?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo5_1084
text_en: You're determined to see the worst in everything, aren't you?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo5_1085
text_en: Fine. We didn't cure exploitation by having robots.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo5_1086
text_en: Bingo. You’ve put your finger right on what I find so depressing about all this.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo5_1087
text_en: Precisely.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo5_1088
text_en: Obviously.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo5_1089
text_en: Right. That's what's so disappointing.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo5_1090
text_en: Um, polite reminder that I didn’t do ANY of that?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo5_1091
text_en: You had all this incredible, magical technology at your fingertips and all you did with it was find new ways to exploit each other. Science made us less equal, not more.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo5_1092
text_en: I'll send your complaint on to the Orokin.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo5_1093
text_en: That's how you know what needs to be changed.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo5_1094
text_en: You're advanced, but you were meant to be ENLIGHTENED too

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo5_1095
text_en: Thanks for bearing with me. I know it's a lot.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo6_2326
text_en: Hey Eleanor? You and Amir are friendly, right?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank2Convo6_2327
text_en: You like boardgames, yeah?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo5_1097
text_en: Oh Gods I don’t mean you personally. I mean your era.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo5_1098
text_en: If anything you went backwards. God-kings in the flesh! Of all the things to reinvent, you reinvented THEM.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo5_1099
text_en: The Tenno killed the Orokin. Did you forget that part?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo5_1100
text_en: No. I didn’t forget the part where the emotionally abused orphans murdered the immortal elite. I just love that bit. If I close my eyes I can almost imagine the screaming.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo5_1101
text_en: Fine. The future’s a mess. You can focus on that if you like.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo5_1102
text_en: That... is... something I'd be careful admitting to people.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo5_1103
text_en: I’m with the people who are trying to make it better.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo5_1104
text_en: ... is irony obsolete in the future too?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo6_1105
text_en: You know what the best thing about Höllvania was, back before the Scaldra took over?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo6_1106
text_en: The nightlife?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo6_1107
text_en: The underground fighting circuit?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo6_1108
text_en: The shopping?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo6_1109
text_en: No idea.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo6_1110
text_en: Not interested. [End.]

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo6_1111
text_en: Boo.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo6_1112
text_en: Oh Gods. Surgically beautiful people getting their immaculate faces off on untested drugs? No.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo6_1113
text_en: Look. I have nothing against watching a pair of sweaty blokes go at one another, hard. But no.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo6_1114
text_en: Good guess. You could get anything from a Bresslin handbag and glove combo to a human eyeball on ice. But no.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo6_1115
text_en: Well, of course you have no idea. You're a fresh-faced newcomer.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo6_1116
text_en: The bath houses!

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo6_1117
text_en: I don’t know if they have anything like that where you are. They’re these temples, I suppose you’d call them, usually with a Sol set of rooms and a Lua set. You can soak in a public or a private pool. Everything smells herbal and steamy and it’s SO GOOD for getting your head back on straight.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo6_1118
text_en: Höllvania’s always had this hugely important tradition of ritual cleanliness. I guess it goes all the way back to the hot springs the city was built on.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo6_1119
text_en: All that ‘purity’ crap Viktor comes out with? He’s singing an age-old tune. All the citizens know where he’s coming from.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo6_1120
text_en: I used to love paying the extra Höllars to have a musclebound professional pound all the tension out of my muscles. You’d have loved it. I’m sure you would.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo6_1121
text_en: I’m not so sure.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo6_1122
text_en: Sounds like my kind of fun.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo6_1123
text_en: What happened to them?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo6_1124
text_en: You'll strut about in a suit made from an Infested human body, but draw the line at massages?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo6_1125
text_en: Weird.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo6_1126
text_en: I knew you were my kind of squadmate.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo6_1127
text_en: I wish some of the others were a bit less uptight. Sadly, there was no way the bath houses could stay open after the outbreaks.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo6_1128
text_en: I’m sure you can guess. The Techrot wrecked so much. There was no way the bath houses could stay open after the outbreaks.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo6_1129
text_en: From what I’ve seen, some of them are basically spawning pools now. It breaks my heart, to tell you the truth. I remember finding thousand-year-old marble and mosaic floors carpeted over with creeping flesh.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo6_1130
text_en: Do you have anything like that in your time?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo6_1131
text_en: Sacred public bath houses? No, not really.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo6_1132
text_en: So what do people do to unwind?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo6_1133
text_en: There’s Rathuum.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo6_1134
text_en: Some people bet on the Index.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo6_1135
text_en: Komi has been around a while.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo6_1136
text_en: Sounds like Amir making sound effect noises to himself...

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo6_1137
text_en: Stockbrokers?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo6_1138
text_en: Komi? Black and white counters? The wedding-war of Sol and Lua?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo6_1139
text_en: It's a Grineer thing. It's ritual arena combat broadcast to the entire System.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo6_1140
text_en: ... sort of? It's like a combination of stock trading and four-a-side violence. I know that sounds weird.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo6_1141
text_en: Um.. yes? Wait, is that what Komi's meant to represent?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo6_1142
text_en: It's a massive deal to them. Deadly serious.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo6_1143
text_en: The Corpus go absolutely crazy for it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo6_1144
text_en: We only know it as a board game!

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo6_1145
text_en: Dad and Arthur used to watch the wrestling together every Saturday night.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo6_1146
text_en: But they're your enemies, aren't they? Or is there some kind of truce when it comes to team sports?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo6_1147
text_en: The Orokin loved it. It's even in Duviri.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank3Convo6_1148
text_en: I had no idea it was THAT old, though.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo6_1149
text_en: Old? It's SACRED! But also fun. A wonderful combination.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo6_1150
text_en: Everything's about the same two essential principles, you know? Mind and body. Symbol and meaning. Sol and Lua.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo6_1151
text_en: Arthur and I used to play Komi every year at Solstice. Why did we ever stop?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo1_1152
text_en: I have to ask you something and I don’t think you’re going to like it. I think you must have known deep down that this conversation would have to happen one day, given my condition.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo1_1153
text_en: I trust you, and I like you, so I’m just going to come out with it, okay?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo1_1154
text_en: I have no right to ask, really, but I need to know.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo1_1155
text_en: If I turned, completely - if the Techrot took me and I wasn’t the Eleanor you knew any more - would you kill me?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo1_1156
text_en: Would you want me to?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo1_1157
text_en: Sure.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo1_1158
text_en: Never.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo1_1159
text_en: I’m not going to answer that.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo1_1160
text_en: Hmm. Good start. You’ve made it about what I want instead of seeing my life as an opportunity to flex your personal morals. You just let me know that this isn’t about you.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo1_1161
text_en: Wow. Okay.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo1_1162
text_en: Okay. Um.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo1_1163
text_en: As you wish.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo1_1164
text_en: That’s rare.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo1_1165
text_en: No hesitation, no struggle, just a simple yes.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo1_1166
text_en: Sorry. I'm actually a little overwhelmed. I didn't expect you to be that forthright.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo1_1167
text_en: I won't ask again.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo1_1168
text_en: Unfortunately it doesn’t get us out of our dilemma, because it means I never get to change my mind.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo1_1169
text_en: Thank you. You're an enigma to me in many ways, but now I know you'd be willing to put a bullet through my head, and that sort of thing is important in the workplace.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo1_1170
text_en: You'd let the monster live?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo1_1171
text_en: I suppose we'll have to wait until it happens to see how you react, won't we?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo1_1172
text_en: Let’s say I say yes, I’d want you to end me quick and clean rather than for me to go on living as a ravening freak. Let’s say that’s what Eleanor wants NOW.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo1_1173
text_en: Aaaand I just felt the Techrot in my cells give an anxious little quiver.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo1_1174
text_en: Sorry, sorry, it's just that I've been living every day with Lettie in my ear crowing about how I don't deserve to be here and Arthur looking at me like I'm a lost cause and he's counting the days till he has to do it, and I just didn't expect you to say that ok

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo1_1175
text_en: You're a lethal little enigma.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo1_1176
text_en: But what if the ravening freak is me, only more so? What if, once my humanity burns away in the Techrot crucible, I don’t WANT to die?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo1_1177
text_en: I think it's going to behave itself a little better from now on. Nothing like threatening the host to put the fear of Sol into the parasite, eh?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo1_1178
text_en: Crying. Happy tears. Talk soon. Please

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo1_1179
text_en: And so am I.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo1_1180
text_en: Because it makes me feel alive, Drifter. Powerfully alive.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo1_1181
text_en: I’d still do it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo1_1182
text_en: Point taken. I wouldn’t do it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo1_1183
text_en: It would depend on how many other people would be endangered.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo1_1184
text_en: You haven’t answered the question. Would you want me to?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo1_1185
text_en: Okay. So we're sacrificing happy, empowered Eleanor on the altar of Eleanor as she used to be?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo1_1186
text_en: Oh, so all I'd need to do is blink my big beautiful eyes at you and your resolve would crumble?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo1_1187
text_en: Ah. Right. In this scenario, I’m an inhuman monster who’s presumably slaughtering people willy-nilly. You get to put me in the ‘predatory animal’ category, along with rabid dogs and hungry bears and such, which means there’s no moral quandary.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo1_1188
text_en: … I don’t know. Some days I think so. I feel like the stock character from a melodrama.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo1_1189
text_en: I can change my mind and decide to live, but you can't change yours?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo1_1190
text_en: What kind of fearless vampire killer would you be then?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo1_1191
text_en: So tell me.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo1_1192
text_en: “Oh no, the hapless girl we once loved has become a sexy vampire. Let us kill her so that in death she will become pure and innocent once again.”

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo1_1193
text_en: Do you wait until I claim my first victim before you pop a bullet through my skull?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo1_1194
text_en: Because if you don’t, how can you be sure I’m a danger?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo1_1195
text_en: I obsessed over it, actually. I had nightmares where I’d wake up on my couch and Arthur would be standing over me, tears in his eyes and sword in his hand, and he’d grate out some line about how Eleanor was his sister but now Eleanor was GONE, and he had to do this even though it was killing him, boo hoo.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo1_1196
text_en: I shouldn't be surprised. It's the ending the stories prepare you for.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo1_1197
text_en: I'll tell you. You'll be the kind who dies halfway through the movie, because they didn't have the heart to Do What Had To Be Done.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo1_1198
text_en: “Oh no, the hapless girl we once loved has become a sexy vampire. Let us kill her so that in death she will become pure and innocent once again.”

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo1_1199
text_en: You'll be a warning to the others, you will!

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo1_1200
text_en: Sorry. I'm not being very fair with you. Talk soon.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo1_1201
text_en: I obsessed over it, actually. I had nightmares where I’d wake up on my couch and Arthur would be standing over me, tears in his eyes and sword in his hand, and he’d grate out some line about how Eleanor was his sister but now Eleanor was GONE, and he had to do this even though it was killing him, boo hoo.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo1_1202
text_en: And as he shoves the blade between my ribs I’m screaming “Eleanor is RIGHT HERE, you stupid bastard!” but he can’t hear me any more.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo1_1203
text_en: So what I’m hearing is, you aren’t willing to decide this question in advance.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo1_1204
text_en: In which case, you can’t expect me to, either.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo1_1205
text_en: And as he shoves the blade between my ribs I’m screaming “Eleanor is RIGHT HERE, you stupid bastard!” but he can’t hear me any more.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo1_1206
text_en: Maybe I'll dream about you next.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorMonster_1207
text_en: Drifter. What you said yesterday. About letting the monster live. Did you mean it? I must know.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorMonster_1208
text_en: Of course, I meant it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorMonster_1209
text_en: Honestly? I've thought about it some more. And, no. I'd have to stop you if you became a monster.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorMonster_1210
text_en: [Ignore.]

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorMonster_1211
text_en: Not that I'm not exceedingly grateful and honestly a little shocked, but... why? WHY would you let me live? When everyone else here would be so willing to put a bullet through my head?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorMonster_1212
text_en: Thank you. You're an enigma to me in many ways, but now I know you'd be willing to put a bullet through my head, and that sort of thing is important in the workplace.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorMonster_1213
text_en: The line between "hero" and "monster" is blurrier than most people like to admit. I've fought against Grineer and Corpus and fought alongside them.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorMonster_1214
text_en: Because I think you're one of the most fiercely intelligent, wonderfully sardonic people I've ever met. I don't even think the Techrot could take that away from you.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorMonster_1215
text_en: Aaaand I just felt the Techrot in my cells give an anxious little quiver.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorMonster_1216
text_en: I think it's going to behave itself a little better from now on. Nothing like threatening the host to put the fear of Sol into the parasite, eh?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorMonster_1217
text_en: How... beautifully naïve. And wonderfully sweet, in a tragic kind of way.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorMonster_1218
text_en: I don't believe in the words "Good" and "Evil." Just people. Why do you have any less of a right to exist than I do? I might not have a Techrot tongue, but I'm just as much of a freak of nature.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorMonster_1219
text_en: But here you are, battling away at the Scaldra and the Techrot, trying to find a way to stop the Indifference. You clearly believe there is some line to be drawn somewhere.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorMonster_1220
text_en: The fact that you believe I would come out the other side some manner of hive queen with my self intact, some bizarre voice of the infestation you could befriend or perhaps even adore.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorMonster_1221
text_en: The Indifference was unleashed by Entrati. A man. Human hubris was to blame for that.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorMonster_1222
text_en: Protecting people from death is not the same thing as believing something should be exterminated or has no right to exist.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorMonster_1223
text_en: Ensuring a flock of sheep doesn't get eaten by wolves is not the same as going out and murdering all the wolves for being evil.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorMonster_1224
text_en: I would chide you for the fact that the world does not function like a storybook, yet... I am reminded of precisely who you are and where you came from.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorMonster_1225
text_en: So I suppose I shouldn't be surprised.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorMonster_1226
text_en: Either way, I guess I am grateful you wouldn't kill me. There's that. At least.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorMonster_1227
text_en: But the Techrot is not the Indifference. What of that? What of the more biological, terrestrial threat?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorMonster_1228
text_en: And what if nothing of Eleanor remained? What if you saw nothing but a hissing, snarling, spitting beast?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorMonster_1229
text_en: We don't really know where the Techrot came from. It could be manmade. It could be from something else entirely.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorMonster_1230
text_en: The simple fact is, you don't want me to kill you. So I wouldn't. I'd let you go.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorMonster_1231
text_en: How do I know nothing of Eleanor remained? You talk about how the Techrot thinks. How it talks to you. It's clearly intelligent.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorMonster_1232
text_en: And if the Techrot turned out to be another man-unleashed aberration like your Man in the Wall? What then? Would you hunt me down and kill me?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorMonster_1233
text_en: While I'm grateful that you would abide by a monstrous lady's wishes, I suppose was hoping for something a bit more... considered.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorMonster_1234
text_en: It seems to be a hive mind. Maybe Eleanor would still be in there, not in one place, but a billion. Who am I to say that's "wrong?"

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorMonster_1235
text_en: No. I couldn't.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorMonster_1236
text_en: Yes. If the Techrot really is unnatural? Then... it has to go.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorMonster_1237
text_en: Either way, I guess I am grateful you wouldn't kill me. There's that. At least.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorMonster_1238
text_en: Just when I simply thought I could not adore you more I find myself once more sitting here crying happy tears

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorMonster_1239
text_en: I have to go but thank you thank you THANK YOU

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorMonster_1240
text_en: You're contradicting yourself. If you're willing to stop one manmade aberration, why not two?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorMonster_1241
text_en: Thank you. You're an enigma to me in many ways, but now I know you'd be willing to put a bullet through my head, and that sort of thing is important in the workplace.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorMonster_1242
text_en: Aaaand I just felt the Techrot in my cells give an anxious little quiver.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorMonster_1243
text_en: I think it's going to behave itself a little better from now on. Nothing like threatening the host to put the fear of Sol into the parasite, eh?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorMonster_1244
text_en: Because I have feelings for you. [Confess feelings.]

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorMonster_1245
text_en: Because you mean too much to me as a friend.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorMonster_1246
text_en: Asking me if I'd kill you is just *cruel,* Eleanor. When the thought of you dead, or in pain, just --

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorMonster_1247
text_en: Asking me if I'd kill you is just *cruel,* Eleanor.  You're my friend. You're like family to me.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorMonster_1248
text_en: The fact of the matter is? No. I couldn't. Because the hope that you'd exist somewhere out there? In some form? Anywhere? Would be enough for me.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorMonster_1249
text_en: The fact of the matter is? No. I couldn't. Because the hope that you'd exist somewhere out there? In some form? Anywhere? Would be enough for me.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorMonster_1250
text_en: I'm sorry. I can't do this. I need to go.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorMonster_1251
text_en: I'm sorry. I can't do this. I need to go.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorMonster_1252
text_en: Oh... oh, what have I done...

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorMonster_1253
text_en: Oh, Eleanor, you stepped in it this time...

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1254
text_en: O Drifter! O vagabond of time and space! How welcome your presence is on this little screen of mine!

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo2_1255
text_en: Hi, Eleanor.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo2_1256
text_en: Brb, Kalymos is playing with the cords again and she might disconn [End.]

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1257
text_en: Hey matey.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1258
text_en: Guess what.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo2_1259
text_en: You’ve got a question about what life is like in the future?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo2_1260
text_en: You've grown a tail.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1261
text_en: Ugh. I’m so tediously bloody predictable.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1262
text_en: ... you'd like that, wouldn't you?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1263
text_en: Alas, no. My bottom has not been improved by the addition of a tail. It cannot be improved, for it is already perfect.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1264
text_en: Yes, I do. Yet another one. But this is a really big one, so bear with me, okay?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo2_1265
text_en: I’ll do my best.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1266
text_en: However, I did have a question for you.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1267
text_en: Good. Great. So.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1268
text_en: How do relationships work in your time? I mean, is it all the usual ‘two or more adults get together with varying degrees of solemnization’ stuff? Or are there all sorts of rules about who can be with who?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo2_1269
text_en: That’s not something I’ve looked into.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo2_1270
text_en: It depends on the culture.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo2_1271
text_en: … why would you ask that?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1272
text_en: Gosh.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1273
text_en: Right. Of course.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1274
text_en: Those two on Deimos, Father and Mother. They’re a married couple. They may be gigantic Infested former Orokin whatnots, but they’re very clearly and painfully MARRIED in exactly the same way my mum and dad are.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1275
text_en: From the bits and pieces I've gleaned from your mind, I still see standard pairings of people. Folks who are very clearly and painfully MARRIED in exactly the same way my mum and dad are.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1276
text_en: So was that standard for Orokin?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1277
text_en: I know you were isolated in Duviri, but I had no idea you were THAT isolated.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1278
text_en: Let me try another tack.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1279
text_en: I'm sincerely sorry if I've caused you any upset by asking.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1280
text_en: Let's see...

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo2_1281
text_en: Orokin were all about rules and taboos. They loved hierarchy. Relationships couldn’t cross social lines. A Dax couldn’t be with an Orokin noble, say.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1282
text_en: Okay. So where you come from, would it be normal for a person to be in a relationship with, say, a Cephalon?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo2_1283
text_en: I could try to drag Ordis back here in time if you'd like to try to find out...

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo2_1284
text_en: … I’ve never heard of it, and I’m not sure how it would work.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1285
text_en: I am trying to ask a THEORETICAL question!

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1286
text_en: I'm not aching to grind myself against your glassy chum, however charming he may be

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1288
text_en: I'm trying, and failing, to ask you about POWER IMBALANCES

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1287
text_en: Damn. Let me try again.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1289
text_en: Make up someone from your time who’s both female and dangerous. Strong, too. Like Major Rusalka without the demonic possession.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo2_1290
text_en: A Grineer sniper?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo2_1291
text_en: A Dax?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1292
text_en: Okay. Let’s say there’s a Grineer sniper lady and she falls for a human. And it’s mutual. Star crossed lovers. Desperately tragic. Could they be together?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1293
text_en: Okay. Let’s say there’s a Dax soldier lady and she falls for a lowly human. And it’s mutual. Star crossed lovers. Desperately tragic. Could they be together?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo2_1294
text_en: If it was what they both wanted, sure.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo2_1295
text_en: Why not?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo2_1296
text_en: I’d like to see anyone try to stop them.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo2_1297
text_en: Yes, but it would be hard.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1298
text_en: I’m tying myself in knots here.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1299
text_en: Thank you.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1300
text_en: Is it normal where you come from for people to get together with partners who are far more powerful and dangerous than they are? Like in ‘Gumbly and the Dragon’s Socks’ when the elf prince ends up married to the giant?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1301
text_en: Question: can two people with wildly differing physiques and lethality levels be in a relationship? Answer: yes.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1302
text_en: … you don’t know what I’m talking about, do you.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1303
text_en: That's all I wanted to know.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo2_1304
text_en: Actually, I’m pretty sure I do.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo2_1305
text_en: Not really, no.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1306
text_en: I'd better stop. I'm in danger of making a complete berk of myself.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1307
text_en: I don’t want to ruin your day. Sorry.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1308
text_en: Can I be allowed a self-pitying rant?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo2_1309
text_en: Rant away.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo2_1310
text_en: I don't have the time for this, sorry. [End.]

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1311
text_en: I am NOT saying my life is meaningless without someone to share it with

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1312
text_en: I am NOT defined by who I choose to love

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1313
text_en: I am sufficient unto myself

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1314
text_en: BUT HOW AM I SUPPOSED TO EVEN ENTERTAIN THE POSSIBILITY OF A RELATIONSHIP WHEN I COULD LITERALLY KILL SOMEONE BY ACCIDENT IF I GOT CARRIED AWAY

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1315
text_en: Welcome to Eleanor and her horny mantis problems

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1316
text_en: If I ever find that Entrati bastard I will turn his balls into earrings. If he has any balls.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo2_1317
text_en: You could always date someone else in the Hex.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo2_1318
text_en: Hold on. You’re single because you’re worried about hurting someone?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1319
text_en: OMFS

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1320
text_en: Yes.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1321
text_en: I AM LITERALLY BITING MY TONGUE SO I DON'T LAUGH

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1322
text_en: The only one of those four I could even CONSIDER dating is Aoi and that's complicated because of Arthur

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1323
text_en: Bless you for suggesting that but no, not in a million years

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1324
text_en: You know what I am better than I do, I think. I’m a Protoframe. I’m a partially transformed war machine, and it feels like it’s getting less partial by the day.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1325
text_en: Whoever designed poor ‘Nyx’ was building a killer. That’s me, now. Efficient. Lethal. Cuddly as a claymore.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1326
text_en: All very well when it comes to the day job, but at the office party who’s going to kiss a walking deathtrap under the mistletoe?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo2_1327
text_en: This accidental hurting you’re worried about. Has it ever happened? Have you ever hurt someone you were with?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1328
text_en: No it hasn’t happened because I haven’t bloody let it. OK?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo2_1329
text_en: I mean, at least the good news is that if there was an accident, nobody in Höllvania stays dead after the reset...

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1331
text_en: No partners, no casualties. Not worth the risk.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1332
text_en: I hadn't considered that.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1333
text_en: I’d rather be lonely than steeped in guilt, thanks.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1334
text_en: Our memories persist, though.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo2_1335
text_en: So you’ve been single since the Entrati shots?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1336
text_en: I don't think anyone would want to be in a relationship with someone who bit their head off once, even if it got better.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1337
text_en: Lua wept. I need a drink now.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1338
text_en: Correct. A trade-off I am quite willing to make.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1339
text_en: Sorry. I’m not sure talking about this was a good idea.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo2_1340
text_en: I think I need to be on my own for a bit.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo3_1341
text_en: I think I’ve done it. I broke through. I made contact.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo3_1342
text_en: Are you there? Please be there.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo3_1343
text_en: Am I going to have to do this over telepathy? Oh God. Please not now.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo3_1344
text_en: Eleanor, slow down. What’s going on?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo3_1345
text_en: [Ignore.]

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo3_1346
text_en: Ever since you appeared, a question has been pestering me. A question I believe I might've just answered. And dear Sol I don't know what I've done.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo3_1347
text_en: Start at the beginning. I don't know what you're talking about. What question?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo3_1348
text_en: You! The question of bloody You. You exist not once but twice.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo3_1349
text_en: And if you could exist in another world, as another version of yourself, why couldn't I?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo3_1350
text_en: Somewhere out there in the now-confirmed-to-exist vast possible universes was that version of myself that I always wondered if I should become.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo3_1351
text_en: The one who turned away from the world to become a nun.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo3_1352
text_en: An apostle of Lua sat on a mountaintop somewhere, incense clouds flowering around her.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo3_1353
text_en: I've been trying to contact her. Trying to reach through the Void to find her.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo3_1354
text_en: Oh no.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo3_1355
text_en: And...?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo3_1356
text_en: The other me. The one who became a nun. I’ve been trying to contact her.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo3_1357
text_en: I just did it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo3_1358
text_en: Of course it was never going to work so long as I stayed in this world. I’m already the ‘me’ of this world. I had to go through the roaring whiteness. The blackstar fugue. The leechbone gulf. That’s how you get to the other sides. The maybes and the could-have-beens.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo3_1359
text_en: The Void! I saw the Void!

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo3_1360
text_en: Are you... sure you didn't get into Lettie's special stash?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo3_1361
text_en: That shouldn’t be possible, Eleanor. Nobody enters the Void until Albrecht Entrati does it. That’s a long way into the future from where we are now.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo3_1362
text_en: Drifter dear, I admire your ability to use humour as a coping mechanism, but right now I am entirely serious.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo3_1363
text_en: I went in with my mind, not my body. That’s the difference.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo3_1364
text_en: I did what I set out to do.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo3_1365
text_en: I not only saw the Void, I entered it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo3_1366
text_en: Ow headache ow ow ow

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo3_1367
text_en: If you really did enter the Void, I cannot tell you how much danger you were putting yourself in. You know what’s out there, and you still just dove into it?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo3_1368
text_en: What did you see? What happened?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo3_1369
text_en: Are you insane?!

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo3_1370
text_en: That’s how I got into the Void in the first place. Through that memory. The horror was just smoke and through the smoke was a GATE. If I hadn’t been so frightened I would have seen it clearly the first time around.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo3_1371
text_en: There’s a feeling there isn’t a word for. You look out on the world and you just KNOW, that all the ordinariness - buildings, cars, people, jobs, work, routine - is just a thin crust over a bottomless horror, and if people ever realized it they’d start screaming and never stop.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo3_1372
text_en: Not even a little bit.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo3_1373
text_en: I fell through the crust.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo3_1374
text_en: Just listen. Please. And try to understand.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo3_1375
text_en: It wasn’t emptiness. I could have borne that. It went on and on forever, but it wasn’t just cold space. There was something in there with me.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo3_1376
text_en: This was a mistake. It took Rusalka. It came damn close to taking Albrecht. It could easily take you too.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo3_1377
text_en: It tried. I felt it. I knew it was curious, reaching for me.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo3_1378
text_en: So out of infinities of possible worlds, you just happened to home in on the right one?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo3_1379
text_en: Eleanor, the Indifference can look like whatever it wants. It looked like Albrecht when he first encountered it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo3_1380
text_en: It’s okay that you’re not convinced. I know this sounds insane. Just hear me out, okay?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo3_1381
text_en: I think maybe it sensed what you wanted and took on the form you were hoping to see.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo3_1382
text_en: I’ll make a deal with you.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo3_1383
text_en: First you let me finish telling you what happened.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo3_1384
text_en: Once I’m done, you can make your own mind up about whether it was the Indifference messing with me or not. I promise I’ll take you seriously.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo3_1385
text_en: Deal?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo3_1386
text_en: Deal.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo3_1387
text_en: I can't believe you did this. Never do that again, Eleanor! I CAN'T LOSE YOU TO THAT THING!

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo3_1388
text_en: Excuse me?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo3_1389
text_en: I'm not sure what to say. I'm a bit concerned, because you sound so upset, but I didn't realise you cared quite so much.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo3_1390
text_en: I'm all right. Please don't worry about me.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo3_1391
text_en: I can't promise anything, but I'll try not to scare you again.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo3_1392
text_en: Fine... just... Tell me what happened.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo3_1393
text_en: I can't be a party to this. [End.]

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo3_1394
text_en: So like I was saying. I found her.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo3_1395
text_en: I could feel the Indifference watching. I could feel it make a face like one of those dried-out desert mummies as it reached out for me. I reached out for her, and she pulled me through.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo3_1396
text_en: She was sitting in the Lotus position in some kind of open-air shrine, next to a pit full of embers. It was nighttime. The moon was dim, ghosting through scrolling clouds.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo3_1397
text_en: She put a finger to her lips.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo3_1398
text_en: For a second I could feel that giant hand still groping for me. Then it recoiled, like a guillotine had come down on one of its fingers.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo3_1399
text_en: Grass whispered. Crickets sang. We were alone.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo3_1400
text_en: We sat across the fire-pit from each other. She didn’t speak, but she let me look into her mind, soft and sisterly.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo3_1401
text_en: This is all sounding horribly familiar. And then?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo3_1402
text_en: She was so happy, so perfectly content. A woman in the place that was right for her. Callused feet, clear eyes. Breathing the fire and drinking the moon.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo3_1403
text_en: So you felt that WOULD have been the right choice for you?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo3_1404
text_en: Did you feel tempted to stay?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo3_1405
text_en: No! Just the opposite!

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo3_1406
text_en: I didn’t need to take that path, because she already had. Don’t you see? I’m free now. I never need to wonder ‘what if’ because there already IS a Sister Eleanor. She’s got my back. Am I making sense?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo3_1407
text_en: Kind of? All I want to know is, did it help?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo3_1408
text_en: Oh yeah. I’ve never been more certain of what to do next.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo3_1409
text_en: I’m going to take the life she freed me up to live, and live it to the hilt.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo4_1410
text_en: Were you and Lettie ever friends?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo4_1411
text_en: This is a pretty close knit group. Have any of you ever dated anyone else in the Hex?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo4_1412
text_en: How would you take it if Arthur got involved with someone romantically?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1413
text_en: Oh Gods, yeah. We were thick as thieves for a while.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1414
text_en: That's a little personal, mate, but I'll allow it. You've been with us a while. You deserve to know the lay of the land.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1415
text_en: Someone not a million miles away, you mean?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1416
text_en: That was before Entrati, of course.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1417
text_en: Apart from Arthur and Aoi dating? No. Not that I know about, anyway... and I WOULD know.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1418
text_en: Don't answer that.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1419
text_en: Now she acts like I’m a different person. Convenient for her. If I’m not really Eleanor then she can be as hurtful towards me as she wants, because she’s not hurting the person she knew. I think it’s cowardly.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1420
text_en: And in case you're thinking about making a move on any of us...

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1421
text_en: If I thought they knew what they were doing and had genuine feelings for the guy, I'd be thrilled. Obviously.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1422
text_en: ... you could do worse than earn Quincy's trust. He sees a lot. Maybe you could take notes.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1423
text_en: But I'd want to make sure they knew how easy it is to hurt him.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo4_1424
text_en: She still wants you to recover from this, though, right?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo4_1425
text_en: Solaris?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1426
text_en: What are those robot things that are all armour and attitude on the outside but the inside is all soft, squishy organics?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo4_1427
text_en: Nox?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo4_1428
text_en: Sentients?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1429
text_en: It doesn't matter. The point is, Arthur's like one.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1430
text_en: Oh, come on. I’ll grow wings and a tail before THAT happens.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1431
text_en: Entrati has buggered off. If there was ever a hope of getting the old Eleanor back, the one who sang in the shower and smiled at kids in the street, that hope left with him.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1432
text_en: If he lets you in, for Sol's sake be gentle with him.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo4_1433
text_en: Lettie needs to look in the mirror and understand she's also just a few bad days away from losing her humanity.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo4_1434
text_en: If Arthur thinks you’re still his sister, that should be good enough for Lettie, too.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1435
text_en: Are you trying to get on my good side?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1436
text_en: YOU WOULD THINK.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1437
text_en: I mean, yes. She does.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1438
text_en: Lettie adores Arthur. He’s the big brother she never had. If Arthur wasn’t around, I’d wake up to a chloroform rag over my mouth and end up at the bottom of the river.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1439
text_en: I still haven't forgiven her for what she said about letting this city burn.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1440
text_en: She thinks he’s delusional, holding on to the past. But she loves the guy and she’s a good soldier, so she’ll never go against him.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1441
text_en: Even Aoi was shocked. It makes you wonder who the real monsters are, doesn't it?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo4_1442
text_en: Why does she hate you so much, anyway?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo4_1443
text_en: Is it seriously just the tongue thing that freaks her out? Or is it the mind reading thing?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1444
text_en: It’s complicated. There’s more than one reason.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1445
text_en: She’s told me to her face that I’m not to go poking around in her head. If I didn’t agree, she’d leave the Hex and take her chances on her own. Insane stuff.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1446
text_en: So part of it is just that she’s scared I’m going to read her teenage diary, as it were. I’ll peer at her most embarrassing secrets and laugh my arse off and she’ll be humiliated forever.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1447
text_en: The truth is, I’m just not that curious. Whatever sick little secret she’s hiding from me, it’s safe.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo4_1448
