text_en: Did you two ever have a... more romantic history together?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo4_1449
text_en: Do you think maybe she LIKES you?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1450
text_en: Do you think I'd kiss and tell?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1451
text_en: It’s crossed my mind.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1452
text_en: No. No we didn't.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1453
text_en: I’d have been up for it, I think. Nothing wrong with a snog and a grope between friends, especially if Arthur had to give us an awkward speech at briefing about how we mustn’t let our feelings get in the way of doing our job.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1454
text_en: Which is just as well, because can you imagine how awkward things would be between us now?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1455
text_en: It blows off steam, it’s good for morale, and it’s cheap.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1456
text_en: I mean... I wouldn't have said no. It just never came up.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1457
text_en: But whatever Ms Garcia is hiding is something people could use to hurt her. So I’m a threat, because I might see it in her head.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1458
text_en: So if you're attracted to her, then go for it! I'll cheer from the sidelines! Lua knows Lettie could use some happiness in her bleak, loveless life.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo4_1459
text_en: Wait, weren’t Arthur and Aoi an item?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1460
text_en: Why? You got designs on my brother? Or on Aoi?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo4_1461
text_en: Well. Um. Actually...

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo4_1462
text_en: Uh... no... I have designs on *you* actually...

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo4_1463
text_en: No. LOL. They're not my type, sorry. Too "heroic."

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1464
text_en: Oh! Oh! DO tell...

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1465
text_en: Interesting.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1466
text_en: HAHAHA

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo4_1467
text_en: Arthur.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo4_1468
text_en: Aoi.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1469
text_en: I KNEW IT.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1470
text_en: I don't blame you one bit.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1471
text_en: I don't have the heart to tell you what you're letting yourself in for. You can walk that road all by yourself.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1472
text_en: Just so we're clear: baiting Arthur is MY prerogative. And if you're ever cruel to him on purpose, I will murder you. One more thing...

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1473
text_en: I know she seems too pure to be real, but believe me, she's a soldier like the rest of us.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1474
text_en: Get to know the REAL Aoi, not whatever image you have in your head of her, and you'll be okay. Also...

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1475
text_en: Arthur and Aoi’s relationship was one of the first casualties of this conflict. Neither one of them is over it. It’s a bit of an open wound, so be careful.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo4_1476
text_en: Why did they break up?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo4_1477
text_en: I couldn't possibly see them working out.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1478
text_en: Why are you asking?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo4_1479
text_en: Never any harm in some harmless gossip.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo4_1480
text_en: It’d help to know, so I don’t rub salt in any open wounds.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1481
text_en: Hmm. I don't agree.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1482
text_en: Aoi's my friend. And however much of a prat Arthur may be, he's still my brother.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1483
text_en: I'm not sure I should be confiding anything in you.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1484
text_en: Okay. I don’t know what THEY would tell you, but from where I’m sitting, they were just pulling in different directions.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1485
text_en: They’re both romantics, just different kinds. Arthur wants the cottage with the roses around the door. He claims he doesn’t, but he does.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1486
text_en: Gods, he even used to talk about taking over a pub sometime. I can just see him with his little crowd of regulars, pulling pints, making Sunday roasts, full of hard-won wisdom.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1487
text_en: Can you see Aoi finding a place in a dream like that? I can’t. She needs to spread her wings.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1488
text_en: Well, you're not alone.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1489
text_en: But you don't go up to grieving people and say 'I told you so'. You rally round. I did my best to comfort Arthur, and Lettie tried to patch up Aoi's broken heart.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1490
text_en: Tread lightly. That's all I'm saying.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1491
text_en: Sorry, that's probably not the response you were hoping for, is it?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1492
text_en: Well.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1493
text_en: We'll see.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1494
text_en: Rugged, dashing Arthur? Pure, kindhearted Aoi? Neither one of them floats your boat?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1495
text_en: I am intrigued.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo4_1496
text_en: We shall talk of this another time, she said, wrapping her crimson cape around her face and stalking away...

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1497
text_en: The Kingdom you used to rule over. Duviri. You didn’t invent it, did you?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo5_1498
text_en: I did and I didn’t. The place and the characters came from a children’s book I used to love. ‘Tales of Duviri’. I brought it to life through the Void.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo5_1499
text_en: I am so sick of talking about Duviri...

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1500
text_en: However did you achieve that?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1501
text_en: Oops. My mistake.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo5_1502
text_en: I was all alone. I guess the other kids were dead, or rescued. I’m kind of hazy on the details.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo5_1503
text_en: It wasn’t exactly intentional. All I remember is…

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo5_1504
text_en: The Angels were coming, breaking through the walls, and I had nowhere to run. I had the book, the and I just remember thinking ‘This is where I can be safe.’

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1505
text_en: Angels? In this time, angels are thought of as benevolent creatures. Terrifying, sometimes, but on the side of good. Unless you mean the fallen ones.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1506
text_en: That was thoughtless of me, wasn't it? The place wasn't exactly a holiday camp for you.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1507
text_en: I'm sincerely sorry. I'll keep my curiosity under control from now on.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo5_1508
text_en: That hasn’t really changed in my time. Angels are meant to be winged, shining creatures from the old stories who help good humans. I’m talking about Void Angels. They’re a whole different beast.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1509
text_en: I see. I can’t imagine something called a ‘Void Angel’ swooping down and blessing a newborn babe.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo5_1510
text_en: So far as I can make out, they used to be people. When the Angels’ song reaches them, they start to change. Once they can’t resist it any more, they become Angels themselves.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1511
text_en: The future, as you describe it, sounds bloody horrible.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1512
text_en: I can’t blame you for wanting to hide away from these Void Angels. Especially if they were…

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1513
text_en: Oh. I just got a feeling. They weren’t your parents, were they?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo5_1514
text_en: I’m fairly certain my parents are dead.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo5_1515
text_en: They could have been. Other kids heard their parents calling.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo5_1516
text_en: I think they were, yeah. Quinn warned me not to look for familiar voices. That must have been what he meant.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1517
text_en: I’m so sorry. I’m glad you found safe harbour, even if it didn’t stay that way.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo5_1518
text_en: It was safe for a long time. Long enough for me to forget. I guess that’s what I wanted to do.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1519
text_en: But how on earth did you do it? You were only a child. What gave you the power to conjure an entire kingdom out of nothing?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo5_1520
text_en: Children are fascinating in the fact that they don't know what they can't do yet. I didn't know I couldn't. So I did.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo5_1521
text_en: I had so many emotions, all at once, that I... just... did something with them. It's hard to explain.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo5_1522
text_en: The Void isn’t ‘nothing’. I know it sounds like it should be, but it’s not. Albrecht proved that.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo5_1523
text_en: We know very little about it, even now. But one thing even the Orokin figured out is this: the Void responds to human emotions.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1524
text_en: When I was five, I wanted to be a witch. I yelled Abracadabra and jumped from the top of the stairs. I didn't know I couldn't fly. But I quickly found out.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1525
text_en: The power to create Duviri must have come from somewhere other than you. You used it to do something incredible, but it wasn't yours.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1526
text_en: Not at first, anyway. It's in you now, though. The wild energy. The loops in time. Gods, you're a wonder.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1527
text_en: I SEE. So if you looked into the Void with… hmm, let’s say ‘hunger’… you might create a prowling half-starved wolf. Or a royal banquet, maybe. Or a loaf of bread with wolf’s teeth gnashing in it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1528
text_en: What a terrifying, exhilarating thought.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1529
text_en: Whyever did the Orokin think it was a good idea to launch a ship full of children into the Void? Wasn’t that an emotional time bomb waiting to go off?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo5_1530
text_en: That’s what that book of stories was meant to be for. On the surface it was all about these over-the-top characters in the court of a mad King who changed his moods every day.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo5_1531
text_en: But the real lesson of the stories was about how to rule over your emotions. We were meant to learn an important lesson from it, so the voyage would be safe.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1532
text_en: Ugh. Sorry, but you’ve ruined it for me now.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1533
text_en: Why can’t stories just be stories? I HATED it when I found out that Rudolfo the Leopard King who died heroically in battle with the Zodiac Serpent was meant to be Sol with his sun-spots, suffering on the star-tree.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1534
text_en: Smuggling religion into kids’ books is like hiding medicine inside sweeties. JUST TELL THEM.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo5_1535
text_en: I’ve never heard of Rudolfo the Leopard King.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo5_1536
text_en: I want to hear the story of Rudolfo the Leopard King someday.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1537
text_en: I can die a happy woman knowing that those books get forgotten about. Hurrah for the future!

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1538
text_en: Ugh. Please, no. It's not a real legend, it's a terrible series of children's books.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1539
text_en: You do have stories, though, don’t you?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1540
text_en: I could tell you some of our real legends, though, if you like.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo5_1541
text_en: Plenty. Even the Tenno and the Warframes have stories.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo5_1542
text_en: I'd like that.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo5_1543
text_en: Not right now. [End.]

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo5_1544
text_en: There’s this guy, Drusus Leverian. He’s like a museum curator. He keeps records of all the legends of the Warframes.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1545
text_en: Well, that’s boggled my noggin. You’re from the far future, but you’ve also been out of the loop in Duviri for so many years that events that happened in your lifetime have had time to become myths?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1546
text_en: I’m getting vertigo.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo5_1547
text_en: Trust me. I know how you feel.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo5_1548
text_en: Tell me about your myths, then.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1549
text_en: You're a storybook character yourself, aren't you?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1550
text_en: Blimey. We’ll be here all year if I start.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1551
text_en: Let’s see. There’s Arthur, of course. Good old Arthur. The original. Britannia’s finest.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1552
text_en: Trapped in a magical kingdom where time flows differently, summoned to the place where you were most needed...

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1553
text_en: Then there’s Young Loxley. I loved her. Wanted to be her. She was the model for a certain kind of young woman.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1554
text_en: All we need to round your story off is a love interest, or a slavering, inhuman monster.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1555
text_en: (Or a slavering, inhuman love interest, depending on how your tastes run.)

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo5_1556
text_en: What’s her story?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1557
text_en: Okay. Potted version: she was the daughter of a nobleman back in ye olde days, when the land was suffering under a cruel King.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1558
text_en: Her brother had been killed off fighting in foreign climes, but word hadn’t reached home yet, so when the poor oppressed people needed a hero she rose to the occasion.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo5_1559
text_en: I've always found the monsters more interesting, anyway. Heroes are boring. Predictable. ...Mundane.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo5_1560
text_en: Mm, I'm not sure if monsters are really my type.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1561
text_en: And that's fine, honestly.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1562
text_en: Monstrosity is in the eye of the beholder, my friend.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1563
text_en: If you are sincerely drawn to the qualities you think 'monstrous' in another, then you had better make sure they share your choice of labels and revel in it. Otherwise, you commit the grossest fetishization.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1564
text_en: Would I call myself a monster, for example? Yes. Enthusiastically. I take the title others would condemn me by, and I rejoice in it. In case you were wondering.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1565
text_en: Monsters are used to being alone.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1566
text_en: We're survivors.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo5_1567
text_en: I thought you hated heroes.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1568
text_en: Now, normally I can't stand hero figures. They're toxic. Infectious, and for that reason, dangerous.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1569
text_en: Young Loxley's different.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1570
text_en: She gets a pass. Shut up.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1571
text_en: As I was saying. She looked a lot like her brother, so she dressed up in his old clothes and pretended to be him, and went off to lead a revolution. If anyone got too close they might notice she was a girl, so she took to wearing a hood. It became her trademark.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1572
text_en: She was shit-hot with a bow and arrow. She and her crew became this beloved band of outlaws, robbing from the King’s tax collectors and giving the money to whoever needed it most.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo5_1573
text_en: Sounds like she would have commanded respect in her own right. Why’d she need to pretend to be her brother?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1574
text_en: That’s history for you. Back then, men supposedly did all the fighting, so they did the ruling too. People expected to take orders from men. She needed to draw on her brother’s reputation to do what she had to do. It was that or go under.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo5_1575
text_en: I'm so glad we fixed that in the future.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo5_1576
text_en: What happened to her in the end?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo5_1577
text_en: I'm not sure we *entirely* fixed that in the future...

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1578
text_en: So am I.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1579
text_en: It depends which version of the story you read. She either got called straight to the Hall of Heroes, or married the King’s wayward daughter, or got trapped in an oak tree where she sleeps to this day waiting for Britannia’s hour of need.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1580
text_en: Not if that Ballas character is anything to go by, you didn't.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1581
text_en: Gods, I'd love to see your era with my own eyes. Maybe you could smuggle me back one of those icebox coffin things and I can just sleeeeeep for a few millennia.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1582
text_en: Hence the saying back home. If things are going badly, like they were during the war, it’s tradition to shrug and say ‘Well, it can’t be THAT bad. Young Loxley’s not turned up yet.’

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo5_1583
text_en: How much bloody longer do we need? FFS.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo6_1584
text_en: So… why crystals?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo6_1585
text_en: So. You and Quincy. Have you ever... y'know?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo6_1586
text_en: Oh, I’ve always loved them. When I was little, my dad took us to the Innovation Museum in Ludston and Arthur and I both got these crystal growing kits. Arthur’s turned out shit, literally like a lumpy little rock turd. It went in the bin. Mine was a beautiful blue diamond. Ever since that day I’ve felt like crystals were on my side, somehow.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo6_1587
text_en: Okay, I'm feeling generous today, so I'll give you this one for free.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo6_1588
text_en: We have never. We have not even slightly.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo6_1589
text_en: So they’re just for decoration, then?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo6_1590
text_en: I cannot help thinking that Quincy's preferred position would be 'partner on top holding a mirror, so he can imagine he's having sex with himself'.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo6_1591
text_en: No thank you. I'm content to admire from afar.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo6_1592
text_en: Ah. No.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo6_1593
text_en: I know there’s a lot of nonsense written about crystals. Not my thing. I don’t believe they purify my aura or light up my chakras.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo6_1594
text_en: But they do have a presence.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo6_1595
text_en: Sorry. I’m aware I sound like a complete headcase.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo6_1596
text_en: I'm glad you said it and not me. They're just fancy rocks.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo6_1597
text_en: I have friends who are Cephalons. They’re literally intelligences in the form of glass cubes. Why would you think I’d mock you for thinking crystals have a presence?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo6_1598
text_en: I spend too much time digging crystals out of the ground for them not to be important on some deeper level. You'd be amazed at how many Warframes were made in part by crystals of one kind or several.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo6_1599
text_en: Oh you are MADDENING sometimes.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo6_1600
text_en: Well, now I feel stupid for feeling stupid.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo6_1601
text_en: Amazed and intrigued!

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo6_1602
text_en: I would have thought that you, of all people, could lift your perspective above the purely material.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo6_1603
text_en: Away with you. Leave me to my fancy rocks.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo6_1604
text_en: I expect you have crystals I could only dream about.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo6_1605
text_en: Tell me, wise traveller, of the crystals of your time.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo6_1606
text_en: Argon. You only find it in the Void, and it disintegrates once you take it out.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo6_1607
text_en: There’s a whole Warframe made of crystal. Citrine.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo6_1608
text_en: We have a pair of doomed lovers who were turned into crystal.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo6_1609
text_en: You say ‘you only find it in the Void’ like people are popping in and out of the Void all the time. I thought it was this crazy-making dimension, not a seaside resort.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo6_1610
text_en: That's her name? I think I glimpsed her in your mind!

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo6_1611
text_en: How beautiful and sad. What must it be like, to become a monument to your love?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo6_1612
text_en: I guess I didn’t tell you about Orokin Towers yet. They’re like strongholds in the Void, set up in case the Sentients tried to attack.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo6_1613
text_en: The pretty geode lady. I suppose she and I are related now. There's a comforting thought.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo6_1614
text_en: I hope nobody chips little bits off them as a keepsake. That would definitely happen in my time.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo6_1615
text_en: People do try, but we keep them safe. It's the least we can do.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo6_1616
text_en: Welcome to the family, I guess?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo6_1617
text_en: Now that’s familiar. There are these top-security bunkers under Ludston and Mancunia. The idea is, if there’s ever a Radiation War, the fat cats and bigwigs get to hide down in their luxury bolthole and sip Mimosas while the rest of us get burned to a cinder up above.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo6_1618
text_en: Same old story, she said with a sigh.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo6_1619
text_en: It’s funny. Everyone was so scared of a Radiation War when I was growing up. I remember the public service broadcasts that used to go out. Sombre advice about how to stockpile supplies, how to prepare a refuge room, and how you really have to bury any dead relatives even if you don’t want to.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo6_1620
text_en: When I saw the reactor exploding in your mind, it took me right back to all those nightmares. I knew we had to stop it, whatever it took. I’d make the others believe you.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo6_1621
text_en: It’s not a Radiation War that’s waiting for this planet, though, is it? It’s the Techrot. One way or another, this loop’s going to work itself out and when it does, the rest of the world’s going to get infected.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo7_1622
text_en: I wanted to ask you something, but I’m not sure how you’ll take it, so if I’m out of order please say so.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo7_1623
text_en: Okay.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo7_1624
text_en: What were your parents like?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo7_1625
text_en: It’s been so long I can barely remember.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo7_1626
text_en: Kind. They tried to do right by me.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo7_1627
text_en: Strict. They were in charge and they let me know it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo7_1628
text_en: Hopeless. I might as well have been raised by feral Kubrows.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo7_1630
text_en: I... can't do this. Sorry. [End.]

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo7_1631
text_en: I'm sorry. I stupidly assumed that because your memories of the Zariman were so vivid, you'd be able to recall your parents, too.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo7_1632
text_en: I forget how many lifetimes you've lived.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo7_1633
text_en: I'm glad. If you don't mind me saying so, it shows.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo7_1634
text_en: There's a warm flame of kindness in you, and I was wondering who had helped to kindle it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo7_1635
text_en: I didn't think you'd had a soft upbringing. I suppose colonists need to be tough.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo7_1636
text_en: With those Orokin in charge, it's a wonder anyone turned out decent.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo7_1637
text_en: Oh dear. Well, for what it's worth, you made a bloody decent human being of yourself.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo7_1638
text_en: I only wish you could have had an easier time of it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo7_1641
text_en: No, I'm sorry. I had no right to ask.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo7_1642
text_en: Why do you ask?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo7_1643
text_en: I was thinking about mine. I do it a lot, actually. I sit on my arse and wonder what Mum and Dad would think about how their kids ended up.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo7_1644
text_en: What were they like as people?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo7_1645
text_en: What were they like as parents?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo7_1646
text_en: As people they were radically mismatched, which means they had the kind of relationship that burns hot and bright for the first few years and then collapses into a sucking black hole after that.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo7_1647
text_en: Incompatible, in a word. Dad wanted us to be independent, so he'd engineer situations where we had to be. Dropping us off in the woods with just a penknife, that sort of thing. Mum was always coming to the rescue. It was doomed.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo7_1648
text_en: Dad is ex-army. Jovial, little wrinkly eyes, speaks like a newsreader, so broken on the inside that if you picked him up and shook him he’d rattle like a bag of gravel. He’s surprisingly easy to upset. I’ve tossed off comments that I thought were mild, then overheard him crying in the loo later on.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo7_1649
text_en: Arthur and I quickly learned to play them off against one another. You know how kids are.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo7_1650
text_en: Mum’s lot were richer, which meant she had a long leash. She didn’t go down the party path, wine and drugs and weeklong binges in Ludston flats. That was more Aunt Janice’s gig. Mum is more flowers, pottery hedgehogs, pot-pourri and everything being Nice.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo7_1651
text_en: Parents always overcompensate for whatever they feel their own parents did wrong, don't they?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo7_1652
text_en: Half of what you’re saying might as well be Voidtongue, but I think I get it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo7_1653
text_en: Well, they’re divorced now. They waited until we were out of our teens to do it, out of ‘consideration’. That was kind, don’t you think? Forcing us to live in a bloody battleground of a house because Kids Need Stability or some such garbage.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo7_1654
text_en: Are you still in touch?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo7_1655
text_en: Once in a while. We used to go back home for Solstice. Now that I do miss. Decorating the star-tree, crowning Sol, little kids going door to door dressed as Lua’s Three Aspects, roasting the bird… it’s sentimental, but I genuinely love it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo7_1656
text_en: Mum and Dad always had a peace treaty for Solstice and they always respected it. On a good year they managed to keep from ripping into each other until after Third Day, even with the plum brandy flowing.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo7_1657
text_en: If you just felt a massive wave of homesickness wash over you, that was me. Sorry.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo7_1658
text_en: I try to keep the big emotions to myself but sometimes they just boil over like milk in a pot, and everyone cops it. Then it’s on to the old KIM for a round of apologies.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo7_1659
text_en: Why bring them up now?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo7_1660
text_en: I was just wondering what they’d make of you. If we ever get out of this place, I’d like to rock up to Solstice dinner with my time-traveling friend.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo7_1661
text_en: I think you’d like it. You and Dad and Arthur could sit by the fire and trade war stories, and Mum could gently prod you about whether you were single.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo7_1662
text_en: I think I’d horrify them.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo7_1664
text_en: I'd be on my best behavior, for your sake.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo7_1665
text_en: Honestly, that sounds like fun.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo7_1666
text_en: Single? Wait, would I be coming home as a partner?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo7_1663
text_en: HA! That just makes me want to do it more.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo7_1667
text_en: That's so sweet of you!

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo7_1668
text_en: Oh Gods, let's do it. If we ever get the chance, we'll make it real.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo7_1669
text_en: Um.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo7_1670
text_en: I can just see Dad politely asking "so was it always death by impalement, or did they try to vary it up a bit?"

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo7_1671
text_en: ... I should let go of this dream before I try to make it happen. We are here, this is now, and there's still a war on.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo7_1672
text_en: Thank you.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo7_1673
text_en: This took a turn, she said, fanning herself.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo7_1674
text_en: I'm going to dream about this. Thank you.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo7_1675
text_en: Thank you for a beautiful dream.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo7_1676
text_en: I've got one more thing to get out of bed in the morning for, now.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo7_1677
text_en: Would you WANT to?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo7_1678
text_en: Honestly? Yes.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo7_1679
text_en: No. I just wasn’t sure what you were imagining.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo7_1680
text_en: Uh… can I get back to you on that?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo7_1681
text_en: You are an absolutely exasperating person.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo7_1682
text_en: I’m trying to have a perfectly innocent conversation about parents, with no ulterior motive, and now you’ve gone and knocked me sideways.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo7_1683
text_en: Right.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo7_1684
text_en: Sorry.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo7_1685
text_en: Yes.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo7_1686
text_en: By all means.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo7_1687
text_en: I'm going to have to give this the serious consideration it deserves. FFS.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo7_1688
text_en: My mistake.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo7_1689
text_en: We have time, and none of us is going anywhere, are we?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo8_1690
text_en: Yes. The one you said was going to be a waste of time, and that you were only playing out of pity for him, that's the one, isn't it?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo8_1691
text_en: Hey Eleanor? You remember that board game Amir is putting together? Fables & Frontiers?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo8_1692
text_en: Hey Eleanor? You and Amir are friendly, right?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo8_1693
text_en: You like boardgames, yeah?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo8_1694
text_en: He's a charming little imp. Why are you asking?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo8_1695
text_en: As much as the next person, I suppose. Why are you asking?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo8_1696
text_en: Yikes. Okay. you're still mad. Noted.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo8_1697
text_en: I figured you were "too cool for it" at the time, and I was just trying to pretend I was, too. Now I know better.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo8_1698
text_en: Yeah I... I just wanted to say sorry about that, I... didn't mean what I said about it. I was just scared you'd say no.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo8_1699
text_en: Which one of us is no longer "too cool" for the game, exactly? You or I?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo8_1700
text_en: Amir's trying to get the team together to play a game of Fables & Frontiers, and I said I'd help.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo8_1701
text_en: Amir really wants to play Fables & Frontiers with everybody. You in?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo8_1702
text_en: Ah. I see. You are the chosen messenger, sent from the Thunderbolt King to enlist fair Eleanor. No doubt all sorts of roguery await me. Fol de rol and so forth.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo8_1703
text_en: You. I still think it's a dorky game, but whatever.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo8_1704
text_en: Me. Definitely me. You're still too cool for the game. But I'm an utter dweeb, or so Quincy says.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo8_1705
text_en: ...Both?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo8_1706
text_en: We've all been there at one point in our lives... trying to wear a mask to impress someone and falling flat on our face because we can't see where we're going. And you and I had barely met when you asked. All right. You're forgiven.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo8_1707
text_en: I think it'll be fun, honestly. And it seems to mean a lot to him.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank4Convo8_1708
text_en: Yeah, I think it's going to be a total waste of time, but I'm trying to be nice.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo8_1709
text_en: I will do you a favour and NOT convey those words along to him. Word to the wise: treat him with more respect in the future in my presence.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo8_1710
text_en: Honestly, putting on a daft voice and play-acting for a few hours sounds ideal. Count me in.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo8_1711
text_en: Oh! I would like to be a wizard. Or perhaps a bard. Or perhaps both? Can you BE both?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank4Convo8_1712
text_en: Or I could be a swamp hag! So long as I get to wear a tight bodice, mind. Mother Mossytits will eat your bones, little manikin.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo6_2253
text_en: What am I saying? Of course there is. That's just how people are.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo1_1713
text_en: Hello, dearheart. I’m feeling a bit on the melancholic side. Do you have a moment?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo1_1714
text_en: Hello. I’m feeling a bit on the melancholic side. Do you have a moment?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo1_1715
text_en: For you, always.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo1_1716
text_en: I'm *really* sorry, I can't right now. [End.]

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo1_1717
text_en: Thank you, sincerely.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo1_1718
text_en: Do you know who the Hooded Woman is?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo1_1719
text_en: La Flaca?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo1_1720
text_en: … a Scaldra assassin?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo1_1721
text_en: One of the faces of Lua?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo1_1722
text_en: Is that your name for Death?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo1_1723
text_en: No clue.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo1_1724
text_en: Hah. Speaking to our dear Lettie, I see. Yes.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo1_1725
text_en: Not quite.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo1_1726
text_en: Yes, actually.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo1_1727
text_en: She’s Death. Also one of the Aspects of Lua, depending on which tradition you follow. She’s the one who comes and tucks you into bed once the knockabout day of Life is over, kisses you goodnight, and sings you to sleep.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo1_1728
text_en: You weren’t kidding about being melancholy, were you?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo1_1729
text_en: This is going to be one of those "get comfy, Drifter, this is going to take a minute" conversations, isn't it?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo1_1730
text_en: Mate. Everything Entrati gave us, the power, the strength, the armour plated arses… I’d trade it all for one crumb of reassurance that death isn’t the end.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo1_1731
text_en: ... it was going to be.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo1_1732
text_en: Forget it. I'm sure you have more important things to do.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo1_1733
text_en: I’ve tried. I don’t feel good about admitting this, but sometimes when we’ve been out on patrol and there’s been fighting, I look into the minds of the dying and try to go through the process with them. If there’s any light at all at the end of the tunnel, I just want to see it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo1_1734
text_en: Eleanor, that’s ghoulish. You have no right.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo1_1735
text_en: Do you try to comfort them at all?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo1_1736
text_en: I know. I KNOW.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo1_1737
text_en: I tell myself I was trying to help but the truth is I just wanted to see. You're right. It was ghoulish.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo1_1738
text_en: I did, once. What’s the harm, right? They’re dying anyway. It was this young Scaldra trooper. She was coming for me and I shot her in the chest.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo1_1739
text_en: I knelt down by her side as she gargled out her lifeblood and tried to tell her it was okay, the pain was coming to an end, soon she’d be with her family who had gone before, all the placid, pacifying stuff you think of when there’s a deathbed service to be held.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo1_1740
text_en: She was terrified. What was left of her conscious self was scrabbling around like a rat in a water tank. When she felt me in her mind with her, she tried to cling on. She begged me to help. Underneath it all was this… I don’t even know what you’d call it…

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo1_1741
text_en: Hope?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo1_1742
text_en: Fear?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo1_1743
text_en: Denial?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo1_1744
text_en: Denial. She didn’t believe she could be dying. And why would she? She’d always been there before. How could death be taking her away now?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo1_1745
text_en: Every day of your life, you take YOURSELF for granted. You’re there when you wake up and you’re there when you sleep. You live out your entire life in a house made of You. You never once go outside, because you can’t.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo1_1746
text_en: Then one day, you hear the house being knocked down.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo1_1747
text_en: Why didn’t you help her?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo1_1748
text_en: Did you stay with her until the end?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo1_1749
text_en: What would you have had me do? Call Lettie over? Heal the gaping chest wound? All because I saw what this one was going through, up close?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo1_1750
text_en: Yeah. I was scared shitless. As she felt herself slipping over the edge, I was sure I’d be dragged down with her. I could feel this undertow tugging at me.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo1_1751
text_en: With the Scaldra it's kill or be killed. They don't offer us the luxury of mercy.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo1_1752
text_en: I had to stay, though. I couldn’t abandon her to die alone.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo1_1753
text_en: Though I guess she did, in the end. I couldn’t take that last step with her.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo1_1754
text_en: What did you learn from the experience?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo1_1755
text_en: So did you see what you were hoping to see?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo1_1756
text_en: I learned nothing.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo1_1757
text_en: No.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo1_1758
text_en: She did, though. She saw her mother’s face, the kids she went to school with, her cat, some cousin who drowned. But they weren’t presences, or spirits. Just memories, forced to the surface by a dying brain desperately hunting for something to cling to.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo1_1759
text_en: Dying person understands what death is. What an insight, Eleanor.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo1_1760
text_en: Then the house of her identity began to come apart around her. Right before she died, she opened her eyes wide. I think in that second, for the first time in her life, she truly understood what death actually is.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo1_1761
text_en: What do you mean? Everyone knows what death is.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo1_1762
text_en: Look. Next time you feel the need to call me out on my bullshit, don't feel you have to sit through it first.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo1_1763
text_en: No. We think we know what it is, but all of our experiences are from the outside.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo1_1764
text_en: Nobody's forcing you to talk to me. Bye.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo1_1765
text_en: Her whole life she was like a woman living in a house with no lights, and all she had was a flashlight. She’d shine the light of her awareness on one spot or another. A memory, a task, an interaction.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo1_1766
text_en: She’d move from room to room, explore the cellars in her sleep, but always it would be a closed, finite process. Do you follow me?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo1_1767
text_en: Not really, but carry on.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo1_1768
text_en: Yes.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo1_1769
text_en: Then when the house was demolished and her persona fell to pieces around her, suddenly the flashlight wasn’t shining on a wall or a book or a couch. It was shining up into the infinite sky. Her awareness blazed into the endless without the obstacle of herself standing in the way.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo1_1770
text_en: I've tried to tell myself that, many times.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo1_1771
text_en: But awareness dies when the body dies. What you experienced was just a spasm in her dying brain.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo1_1772
text_en: You think ‘awareness’ is who we really are and the rest is just a shell?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo1_1773
text_en: Wow. So deep. You shot someone and then violated her privacy.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo1_1774
text_en: I can't believe it was nothing more than the brain shutting down. It felt like the soul breaking free.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo1_1775
text_en: I know it doesn’t make any kind of sense. It feels so counterintuitive, the idea that we are a point of view first and a personality second. All I know is that’s how it felt to be with a human soul as it passed from life to death.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo1_1776
text_en: Look. Next time you feel the need to call me out on my bullshit, don't feel you have to sit through it first.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo1_1777
text_en: Nobody's forcing you to talk to me. Bye.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo1_1778
text_en: How do you feel about all of that?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo1_1779
text_en: Comforted? I like the idea that something of us survives. I love thinking that death isn’t about being deleted from the universe, but having everything deleted that separates you from the universe.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo1_1780
text_en: But what makes us US isn’t just raw awareness. It’s memory, emotion, opinion, all sorts of layers. When you lose all that you’re losing a real person, even if that spark somehow survives.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo1_1781
text_en: I know.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo1_1782
text_en: Honestly, this is why I wanted to talk to you about void ghosts and Cephalons and all of that stuff from your time. I need to know if we ever get the chance to communicate with people we’ve lost.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo1_1783
text_en: Real communication, not some hologram crap. The kind that lets you know definitively what the person thought.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo1_1784
text_en: No, not really. Even in the future, the people we've lost are... for better or worse? Just... gone.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo1_1785
text_en: Eleanor, get to the point. Who did you lose?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo1_1786
text_en: I see. Maybe there are some doors we can never open. Maybe that's for the best.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo1_1787
text_en: His name was Christopher. He was Arthur’s best friend.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo1_1788
text_en: We were engaged. I thought I was in love with him.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo1_1789
text_en: I’m sorry. I can’t do this. I’ll talk to you another time.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_1790
text_en: Right. I’m calm and as ready as I’ll ever be.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_1791
text_en: Can I talk to you about Christopher?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo2_1792
text_en: Who's Christopher?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo2_1793
text_en: Why is he someone I need to know about?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_1794
text_en: Arthur's best friend. We were engaged. I thought I was in love with him.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo2_1795
text_en: I’m listening.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo2_1796
text_en: [Ignore.]

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_1797
text_en: Thank you.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_1798
text_en: Because he’s someone I lost. Someone who was very dear to me.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_1799
text_en: Since you and I are a lot closer now (in so many delightful ways) you should really know what who you're getting involved with.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_1800
text_en: Please correct me if I’m wrong, but lately I’ve been feeling like you and I are more than just teammates.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_1801
text_en: I've seen inside your head, but you've not seen inside mine.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_1802
text_en: So, please brace yourself and bear with me.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_1803
text_en: You've made it pretty plain to me how you feel, which I appreciate.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_1804
text_en: We’re definitely friends. Maybe more than that. But we’re still pacing uncertainly around one another and waiting for the other one to make the first move.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_1805
text_en: I like you, very much. I trust you. You’ve had plenty of opportunities to treat me like a freak, like Lettie does, and you haven’t done it. Don’t think I haven’t noticed.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_1806
text_en: I want to tell you about Christopher because I think you deserve to know.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo2_1807
text_en: Go ahead.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo2_1808
text_en: I don't have time for this right now, sorry. [End.]

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_1809
text_en: There's a time to bail on a conversation with a friend. This was not it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_1810
text_en: He was older than Arthur and me by a few years. I can’t remember a time when he wasn’t around. Our parents were friends, so he was always over.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_1811
text_en: He used to play at soldiers with Arthur in the scabby patches of woodland down behind the estate. Christopher was the commander, Arthur the loyal lieutenant. If they ever let me play, I had to be the nurse. Obviously.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_1812
text_en: I wish Dad had looked out at Arthur throwing himself on yet another pinecone grenade, dying valiantly to save his CO, and thought ‘hmmm, my boy’s getting a bit too fond of this Army lark, maybe I should tell him getting shot up isn’t as much fun as he thinks.’

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo2_1813
text_en: You think Arthur would have listened if he had?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo2_1814
text_en: I think it all worked out okay, all things considered.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo2_1815
text_en: But if Arthur'd listened, then we never would have met. :)

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_1816
text_en: Our paths crossing was a rare blessing in my life, yes.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_1817
text_en: In some respects, yes.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_1818
text_en: Probably not. He’d just have seen it as Dad testing him.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_1819
text_en: But I was trying to tell you about a bereavement here.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_1820
text_en: But allow me to wish it had not come at such a cost.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_1821
text_en: Especially when I haven't yet told you how deep the wounds go.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_2257
text_en: Not really the time to look for silver linings.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_2258
text_en: Anyway. Summer after summer rolled past. We grew to be adolescents. It was all very awkward and smelly and hormonal. There were parties and exams. Christopher went off to college. The dog died, we got a new one. Insert montage here.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_2259
text_en: Suddenly one day I walked into the kitchen, I saw this stunning young man in uniform in front of me, and I thought ‘phwoar’ for the second time in my life.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo2_2260
text_en: I'm sorry, what was that sound again? I missed it. :P

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo2_2261
text_en: Who was the first?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_2262
text_en: 'Pwhoar'?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_2263
text_en: It's a traditional Britannic expression of admiration. It should be delivered in a sort of low growl, puffing the cheeks out.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_2264
text_en: Mandy Jellicoe. My crush. She dropped out of school, dyed her hair, got piercings, hung around town in a leather jacket smoking cigarettes and glowering at anyone who came too close. I looked at her and I could feel my bones melt.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_2265
text_en: Anyway. NOT RELEVANT.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo2_2266
text_en: So you and Christopher…

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_2267
text_en: Yep. He was kind. Gorgeous. Strong. Easy to wind up, too, which was a big plus. Hell-bent on joining the army, though.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_2268
text_en: We didn’t see eye to eye on that. To him it was a calling. He’d be out there helping people who needed it, making a difference in the world. He’d bought into the whole manly hero line, just like Arthur.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo2_2269
text_en: I know how much you hate the concept of heroes. Is this why?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo2_2270
text_en: He was right. People willing to fight for a better world is the only thing that makes a difference.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo2_2271
text_en: It’s a compelling idea. People want to help. Easy to take advantage of that.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_2272
text_en: Yes. I hate what it did to Christopher, what it's still doing to Arthur, what it does to so many like them.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_2273
text_en: I have nothing against morals. Gods know I even have a few myself. But the whole hero narrative is pernicious bullshit.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_2274
text_en: You can fight for a better world without buying into the hero bullshit!

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_2275
text_en: The whole point of the Hero Virus is that it's a virus. IT DOES NOT CARE ABOUT THE HOST. It convinces you hat dying in a cause would be fitting and noble, instead of being a tragic bloody waste.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_2276
text_en: ‘Why do you want to go and kill people in the name of a Prince who couldn’t give a shit about you?’ I’d say to him. He’d be hurt, because it wasn’t supposed to be about His Majesty’s Service. For him it was about taking out warlords who hoarded food and forced their political prisoners to work in the Rubedo mines until they died of exhaustion.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_2277
text_en: I was confident I’d be able to talk Christopher out of his military service. If not talk, then snog him out of it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo2_2278
text_en: That’s kind of arrogant of you.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo2_2279
text_en: I'm bracing myself for the "but."

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo2_2280
text_en: Sounds like he’d already made up his mind.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo2_2281
text_en: ...Note to self: Argue with Eleanor...

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_2284
text_en: Yes, and?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_2285
text_en: I was trying to save his life. I was willing to fight as dirty as it took.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_2286
text_en: Do I need to spell it out?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_2287
text_en: I got caught up in the very web I was trying to spin.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_2288
text_en: Right. By then, of course, it was too late. I’d gone into this thinking I’d bewitch him, but the truth is, he bewitched me.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_2282
text_en: ... not really the time.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_2283
text_en: This isn't easy for me so please choose your moment a bit better

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_2289
text_en: I’m sorry. I’m not going to be able to get through this without crying, so if I’m slow in responding, at least you’ll know why.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_2290
text_en: I told him I was pregnant. He offered to marry me. Stupid beautiful idiot.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo2_2291
text_en: Were you?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_2292
text_en: No. But I thought I was. I didn’t try to trick him, if that’s what you were asking.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_2293
text_en: Arthur was skipping on fluffy clouds, he was so happy. The guy he saw as a brother was going to be his brother-in-law.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_2294
text_en: Then everything goes into fast-forward. Something about a pre-emptive strike. Borders and containment, risk of escalation, moral bloody mandate. Christopher’s deployed, Arthur’s already signing up, all the boys are off to the Crimson Watch and my mum’s still trying to arrange the wedding seating.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo2_2295
text_en: So what happened?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo2_2296
text_en: Are you okay to carry on?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_2297
text_en: They killed him. The people we were supposedly there to help. They blew his vehicle apart with a bomb made from fertilizer and masonry nails.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_2298
text_en: I tell myself ‘at least it was quick’. ‘At least he didn’t suffer.’ But for all I know, he died screaming with nails in his eyes

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_2299
text_en: Shit

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_2300
text_en: Shitting shit

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo2_2301
text_en: At least he died doing what he felt was right...

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo2_2302
text_en: I'm so sorry...

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_2303
text_en: I feel like you haven't paid attention to a SINGLE THING I've been saying to you here

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_2304
text_en: I'm not interested in 'at least...' He died in a STUPID way for a STUPID reason

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_2305
text_en: I cried of course but all the time I was thinking ‘what did you expect, you STUPID girl, you KNEW what you were getting into, you KNEW this was going to happen’

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_2306
text_en: Telling you about it like this, it just feels like corny folk song shit

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_2307
text_en: My love he is gone off to war, sing fol de rol de dee, oh no he’s dead, I shall wander in the lonesome valleys and never wed another

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_2308
text_en: And if you aren't listening to me when I talk about this, what else aren't you hearing? As charming as this has all been between us I... no. This was a mistake.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_2309
text_en: And if you aren't listening to me when I talk about this, what else aren't you hearing?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_2310
text_en: This whole bloody thing was a mistake. We're through.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_2311
text_en: Sorry. Get it together, Eleanor.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_2312
text_en: I think he’d have liked you.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo2_2313
text_en: Got to go tidy myself up. Talk again soon.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo3_1822
text_en: Sometimes I have to ask myself why you’re still here.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo3_1823
text_en: Wow. Thanks.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo3_1824
text_en: For the company.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo3_1825
text_en: There’s still work to do.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo3_1826
text_en: I have my reasons.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo3_1827
text_en: Oh Gods. Sorry. I didn't mean it like that. I'm just having trouble seeing MYSELF as the reason you'd tolerate all... this.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo3_1828
text_en: ... are we talking about the same people here?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo3_1829
text_en: I mean… we know what we’re doing now. We’re containing the spread. You’ve done what you were sent to do. You don’t HAVE to stay. And yet…

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo3_1830
text_en: Oh, don't get cryptic. I'll feel compelled to worm the information out of you somehow.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo3_1831
text_en: I thought the fact that we were together would be a good enough hint as to why I wanted to be here.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo3_1832
text_en: Do I have to spell it out? I’m here because of you. [Confess feelings.]

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo3_1833
text_en: I care about this team immensely. You're all... a family to me, now. One I've never really had.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo3_1834
text_en: I'm so sick of having this conversation with people. I'm not leaving. That's it. [End.]

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo3_1835
text_en: ... wait, did you just leave?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo3_1836
text_en: Well, now I’m wondering what I did to trick you. Or manipulate you. Maybe I put some kind of suggestion in your head.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo3_1837
text_en: And I thank the Gods for the day you joined us.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo3_1838
text_en: Well, now I’m wondering what I did to trick you. Or manipulate you. Maybe I put some kind of suggestion in your head. Or maybe there’s a secondary Techrot virus in your system that’s attracted to what’s in mine.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo3_1839
text_en: I’m attracted to YOU, Eleanor. For all sorts of reasons.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo3_1840
text_en: I'm glad you found what you were looking for. All rivers find their way to the sea, eventually.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo3_1841
text_en: Or maybe there’s a secondary Techrot virus in your system that’s attracted to what’s in mine.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo3_1842
text_en: Or maybe (deep breath) you actually like me the same way I like you. Could it really be that simple?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo3_1843
text_en: I thought I already made that clear.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo3_1844
text_en: As families go, this one's a mess. But I wouldn't change it for the world.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo3_1845
