text_en: I’ll make a deal with you. Go and see Lettie, ask her to run you through a quick psych-eval, get to the bottom of whatever’s REALLY going on here, and we’ll just forget this conversation ever happened.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo3_1846
text_en: I don’t need a psych-eval. There’s nothing crazy about liking you. If you don’t feel the same way about me, please say so.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo3_1847
text_en: If you don't feel the same way about me, just come out and say it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo3_1848
text_en: Wow. Okay. Never mind.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo3_1849
text_en: See? That was easy.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo3_1850
text_en: OF COURSE I FEEL THE SAME WAY

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo3_1851
text_en: YOU ARE THE BEST THING THAT EVER BLOODY HAPPENED IN MY ABSURD LIFE

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo3_1852
text_en: WHICH MEANS YOU’RE NOT GOING TO BE PART OF IT FOR LONG AND THE SOONER WE BOTH ADMIT THAT THE BETTER

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo3_1853
text_en: BECAUSE THAT’S HOW IT WORKS

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo3_1854
text_en: I know you’ve lost people. So have I. We’re not alone in that.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo3_1855
text_en: Eleanor, I’m not going anywhere. Right here, with you, is where I want to be.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo3_1856
text_en: No. We’re not alone, are we? And we never have to be.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo3_1857
text_en: Right. I can see you've made your mind up.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo3_1858
text_en: I could come up with a dozen different reasons why we shouldn’t be together, and you’d have an answer for every one of them. Oh, what if I infect you? You’re immune. What if I try to eat you? You’re functionally immortal. What if I see inside your head? I’m sure you’d just kick me out again.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo3_1859
text_en: You wonderful, impossible creature. You’ve only gone and won me over, you have.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo3_1860
text_en: Oh, one last thing. I don’t know if you’ve noticed, but I have this embarrassing personal problem. We do need to address it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo3_1861
text_en: Your glowing eyes keeping me awake at night?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo3_1862
text_en: The mind reading?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo3_1863
text_en: The tongue?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo3_1864
text_en: "I love to watch you sleeeep..."

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo3_1865
text_en: That's more embarrassing for OTHER people.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo3_1866
text_en: Well I’m not talking about the size of my arse am I?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo3_1867
text_en: No. I'm referencing my tongue. The anaconda in the room.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo3_1868
text_en: Yes, the tongue. The anaconda in the room.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo3_1869
text_en: Tell me, honestly. How do you feel about it?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo3_1870
text_en: It’s gross, but for you, I'll look past it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo3_1871
text_en: It’s not a problem for me.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo3_1872
text_en: Honestly...? Kind of into it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo3_1873
text_en: So... I'm not the first tentacle-tongued woman you've flirted with? Actually, don't answer that. I'm scared to learn the answer.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo3_1874
text_en: Right.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo3_1875
text_en: Oh! I see! You imagined you were doing me a favour!

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo3_1876
text_en: Well. That’s that settled, then.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo3_1877
text_en: I appreciate your honesty.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo3_1878
text_en: I'm afraid the closest you will get to me now is if you set yourself on fire.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo3_1879
text_en: I’m scared. Excited. Nervous. Frankly, more than a little aroused. Might be getting ahead of myself there.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo3_1880
text_en: Shall we do this?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo3_1881
text_en: I wish you the best of luck finding a less 'gross' person to be intimate with.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo3_1882
text_en: In which event, I might bring myself to piss on you.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo3_1883
text_en: Yeah. :) [Date Eleanor.]

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo3_1884
text_en: I... need some more time to think this over.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo3_1885
text_en: Of course. Let's do that, then.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo3_1886
text_en: Gods. I hadn’t even thought of that.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo3_1887
text_en: How do you think the others are going to take it?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo3_1888
text_en: Right now I’m too happy to care, but I suppose we ought to tell them.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo3_1889
text_en: Hmm. I’m thinking seriously about pouncing you in Arthur’s office and ‘accidentally’ turning the tannoy on so that Lettie can hear every gasp.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo3_1890
text_en: Better not, though. Life’s traumatic enough as it is.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo3_1891
text_en: It’s a nice idea. Though maybe not the security office, and not with the tannoy on.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo3_1892
text_en: What's a tannoy?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo3_1893
text_en: Hold that thought, lover. Let’s see where imagination takes us.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo3_1894
text_en: It's the loudspeaker thing. 'The Mall will be closing in five minutes, blah blah blah, shoplifting is punishable by summary execution.'

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo3_1895
text_en: So help me, I do love how bewildered you are sometimes.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo4_1896
text_en: Dear? If you're there, I could use your ear.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo4_1897
text_en: If you’re there, I could use a friend.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo4_1898
text_en: I’m having the Arthur dreams again. The ones where he has to kill me.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo4_1899
text_en: I keep having this terrible dream about Arthur where he has to kill me. And as he shoves the blade between my ribs I’m screaming “Eleanor is RIGHT HERE, you stupid bastard!” but he can’t hear me any more.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo4_1900
text_en: I’m here. It’s okay.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo4_1901
text_en: [Ignore.]

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo4_1902
text_en: Arthur’s not going to kill you, Eleanor. You’re his sister. He knows that.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo4_1903
text_en: That’s just it, though. ‘You’re not my sister any more.’ That’s what he says in the dream. Then he stabs me through the chest with his toy sword.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo4_1904
text_en: We’re only little kids in the dream, if it wasn’t already messed up enough.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo4_1905
text_en: It’s not real. I don’t believe Arthur would ever hurt you, no matter how Infested you were.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo4_1906
text_en: ... Yikes.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo4_1907
text_en: Not even to ‘put me out of my misery’? Not even if I was suffering?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo4_1908
text_en: Yeah. That's the worst part.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo4_1909
text_en: It's so vivid, so real. Like I'm remembering something that actually happened.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo4_1910
text_en: I'm sure Arthur wouldn't actually do that, though.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo4_1911
text_en: Maybe you should talk to Arthur about it?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo4_1912
text_en: I can't. He’s his father’s son. He’s all about doing the right thing, not the easy thing.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo4_1913
text_en: He’s his father’s son. He’s all about doing the right thing, not the easy thing.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo4_1914
text_en: However bad you think your family was, it's nothing compared to some I've met.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo4_1915
text_en: Wait. What’s your father got to do with this?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo4_1916
text_en: I'm sure. The future is quite inventive in its cruelty.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo4_1917
text_en: Everything.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo4_1918
text_en: But my concern here is with the past.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo4_1919
text_en: You’re going to have to give me more than that if you want me to understand.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo4_1920
text_en: Eleanor. Please stop being obtuse on purpose.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo4_1921
text_en: It’s one of the many, many things we don’t talk about.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo4_1922
text_en: I'm not.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo4_1923
text_en: I'm honestly trying my best to explain.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo4_1924
text_en: My father set the example for the way Arthur and deal with issues between us. Or rather, the way we don't.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo4_1925
text_en: We don’t talk about what happened in Cavona, we don’t talk about Christopher and we NEVER talk about Granny Callie.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo4_1926
text_en: Then maybe you shouldn't.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo4_1927
text_en: Then maybe you should.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo4_1928
text_en: Maybe I shouldn't.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo4_1929
text_en: Maybe I should.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo4_1930
text_en: Maybe it’s time.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo4_1931
text_en: Do you want the whole story? Or shall I boil it down to essentials?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo4_1932
text_en: I’m not going anywhere. Give me the whole thing.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo4_1933
text_en: Can I get the abridged version?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo4_1934
text_en: Granny Callie was desperately sick. Demented. Our father suffocated her to death with a pillow rather than let her go on suffering. I hope that's curt enough for you.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo4_1935
text_en: Granny Callie was our paternal grandmother. Callista Penrose Nightingale.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo4_1936
text_en: She had Pelham’s Syndrome. You’ve probably cured it by now (she said with an inward wrench). It chips away at a person’s mind. Instead of watching someone you live die all at once, they fade away slowly, by degrees, like an old photograph parching in the sunlight, or a video copied too many times over.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo4_1937
text_en: Like what was happening to Suda that made her decide to become a Cephalon. I understand.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo4_1938
text_en: Actually... no, we haven't really cured that...

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo4_1939
text_en: When she first came to live with us, Arthur and I were so excited. To us, she was the lovely old woman who smelled of violets and told stories where she did all the different voices. She gave us actual folding money on our birthdays. We thought it would be like a birthday all the time.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo4_1940
text_en: Then she started to go downhill. At first she was just forgetful. Then she started confusing us with other people. She called me Albertine and Arthur, Charlie. Demanded to know where Jimmy had run off to. We never found out whether Jimmy was a dog or a cat or a boyfriend.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo4_1941
text_en: Then she started talking to people who weren’t there. Then she started wandering the house after dark.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo4_1942
text_en: I remember going for a wee in the middle of the night and seeing her lurching towards me down the corridor in the dark, groaning, her face all twisted up and her hair like a mad clown wig. I couldn’t stop screaming.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo4_1943
text_en: That must have been frightening for you both.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo4_1944
text_en: Oh, Void.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo4_1945
text_en: When it got really bad, she would lie in bed and shriek. We’d go out to school in the morning and when I turned down our lane, my heart would sink because I could hear her from ten houses away, still screaming, eight hours later.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo4_1946
text_en: Our dad used to talk about putting a pillow over her face. We thought he was joking, because of course he was, that’s his mum.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo4_1947
text_en: And now a lot of things make sense.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo4_1949
text_en: One night she was screaming, and the screams just stopped. I got up and went to Arthur’s room. He was awake, of course. We sat together listening and listening, and then we heard the door to her room close.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo4_1950
text_en: Died in her sleep, Dad said the next day.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo4_1951
text_en: And you’re scared that Arthur might do the same to you?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo4_1952
text_en: Arthur isn't your father. He wouldn't do what he did.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo4_1953
text_en: If he honestly thought it was for the best?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo4_1954
text_en: You have no way of knowing that. If Arthur honestly thought it was for the best?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo4_1955
text_en: I don’t know. Maybe. It seems a lot less likely now I’ve actually told someone.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo4_1956
text_en: You’re wonderful. Thank you for bearing with me. I needed to get that out.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo5_1957
text_en: Hey, Eleanor.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo5_1958
text_en: [Ignore.]

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo5_1959
text_en: Hello my darling.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo5_1960
text_en: Hello, mysterious and oddly compelling stranger from another time.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo5_1961
text_en: I haven’t had the Arthur dream once since I told you about Granny Callie. I think you exorcized that demon.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo5_1962
text_en: Did you sleep better last night?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo5_1963
text_en: Did you have another nightmare?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo5_1964
text_en: But since we’ve been together, something else has been happening. It’s a bit awkward actually. I’ve been meaning to talk to you about it, but there hasn’t been a good time.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo5_1965
text_en: But that's not to say there haven't been OTHER dreams. Rather disturbing ones.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo5_1966
text_en: You’re dreaming about me?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo5_1967
text_en: You’re dreaming about us?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo5_1968
text_en: Awkward? This doesn’t sound good.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo5_1969
text_en: That wouldn't be awkward. This is.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo5_1970
text_en: Gods, I wish. Nothing so pleasant, I'm afraid.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo5_1971
text_en: Don’t worry. It’s not bad as such. I’m not frightened. It’s just...

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo5_1972
text_en: (Okay, Eleanor, deep breath, you can do this)

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo5_1973
text_en: I think the Techrot’s jealous.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo5_1974
text_en: I don't think you disturb easily.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo5_1975
text_en: Falling down an endless flight of stairs?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo5_1976
text_en: Could be important. With your ability, a dream might not be just a dream.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo5_1977
text_en: I don't, which is why this is so troubling.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo5_1978
text_en: No, not that one. Funny that everyone seems to have had it, though.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo5_1979
text_en: That's exactly what I'm afraid of.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo5_1980
text_en: (Okay, Eleanor, deep breath, you can do this)

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo5_1981
text_en: I think the Techrot’s jealous.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo5_1982
text_en: You have got to be joking.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo5_1983
text_en: Jealous?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo5_1984
text_en: You have got to be joking.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo5_1985
text_en: Jealous?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo5_1986
text_en: Oh, how I wish I were.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo5_1987
text_en: Jealous of our friendship, yes.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo5_1988
text_en: Oh, how I wish I were.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo5_1989
text_en: Jealous of you for taking me away, yes.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo5_1990
text_en: On some profoundly messed up level, it thinks of me as its property. I was meant to be its breeding prospect. The Legacytes see me as a rival queen, you know.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo5_1991
text_en: On some profoundly messed up level, it thinks of me as its property. I was meant to be its breeding prospect. The Legacytes see me as a rival queen, you know.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo5_1992
text_en: That’s not how Warframes work. The Infestation in them is tamed, it’s dormant. Except for Nidus, I guess, but he’s a law unto himself.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo5_1993
text_en: So the Techrot thinks I stole you from it, and now it wants you back?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo5_1994
text_en: That’s not how Warframes work. The Infestation in them is tamed, it’s dormant. Except for Nidus, I guess, but he’s a law unto himself.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo5_1995
text_en: So the Techrot thinks I'm keeping you from going back to it?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo5_1996
text_en: Well, maybe if I were a full Warframe, the Techrot wouldn't see me this way. As it is, my cells are still fizzling, and it sees me as its own.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo5_1997
text_en: Well, maybe if I were a full Warframe, the Techrot wouldn't see me this way. As it is, my cells are still fizzling, and it sees me as its own.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo5_1998
text_en: Isn’t it bizarre? The jilted ex!

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo5_1999
text_en: Yes. It wants me back in its gang.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo5_2000
text_en: Where I come from, you’d have to go and have a fight with it round the back of the local supermarket. I’m not sure how it works in your time.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo5_2001
text_en: This is your REAL family, it whispers. Become part of us again, severed sister. Be accepted.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo5_2002
text_en: Wait, back up a bit. How do you know that’s what the Techrot is feeling?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo5_2003
text_en: Oh Gods, this is the awkward bit.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo5_2004
text_en: The dreams I mentioned before? I'm certain the Techrot's sending them.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo5_2005
text_en: Whatever that stuff has that passes for a mind, it’s always been able to connect with mine. The thoughts it sends are always so crude and weak I can easily fend them off.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo5_2006
text_en: Most of the time it just feels like this frantic scratching at the back of my skull, like when you’re in the loo and there’s a cat trying to get the door open.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo5_2007
text_en: But when you’re asleep it’s a different story, right?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo5_2008
text_en: I think I can see where this is going.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo5_2009
text_en: Right. My defenses are down, and it can reach me.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo5_2010
text_en: It’s been hitting me on the most primordial level, if you know what I mean. It wants me back. It promises it can make me feel ecstasy I’ve never known.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo5_2011
text_en: It will seed my flesh with the dripping cysts of new life. Because it thinks that’s what I want, you see.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo5_2012
text_en: Okay, I guess that’s it for us. How can I compete with that?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo5_2013
text_en: I will *burn it all* before I let it take you.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo5_2014
text_en: I'm never going to let it take you, Eleanor. You're my friend.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo5_2015
text_en: You're like family to me. I won't let it have you.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo5_2016
text_en: Now that's the kind of talk that gets a Drifter absolutely covered with kisses.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo5_2017
text_en: I know. I think it knows, too, which is why it's so angry. It can't compete.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo5_2018
text_en: I'll sleep easier knowing you have my back.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo5_2019
text_en: It’s okay, my sweet. I’m not about to leave you for a suppurating mass of tubercular flesh with lumps of orphaned technology floating in it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo5_2020
text_en: Just… if you see me looking especially dark-eyed and gaunt on any particular morning when we wake up together, please bring me a nice strong coffee and don’t press me for details?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo5_2021
text_en: Fancy giving the Techrot something to be REALLY jealous of?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo5_2022
text_en: We'll face it together, then. Side by side. Always.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo5_2023
text_en: We're family. Blood and found. Unbreakable.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo5_2024
text_en: I can do that.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo5_2025
text_en: ...Noted.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo6_2026
text_en: You might notice the Mall feeling a little different this morning.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo6_2027
text_en: Nothing big and obvious. Just a few more smiles on a few more faces. A laugh here and there. A sprinkle of happiness on the air.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo6_2028
text_en: That’s down to you, right?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo6_2029
text_en: BRB. [End.]

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo6_2030
text_en: Just my way of giving back. A telepath can send as well as receive, as you know. It doesn’t have to be a hosepipe jet to one person. It can be more like a fine mist sprayed over an area.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo6_2031
text_en: Do you have lawn sprinklers where you come from?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo6_2032
text_en: We have VERD-IE and drones like her. They looked after the plants on the Zariman. Is that the kind of thing you mean?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo6_2033
text_en: Sprink...lers?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo6_2034
text_en: It’ll do.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo6_2035
text_en: Yes, my dear, sprinklers. Water sprayers for keeping your lawn nice and damp.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo6_2036
text_en: I loved lawn sprinklers when I was a little girl. They were magical. When the sun was brightest, you could catch rainbows in them. You’d run through them and feel a delicious chill all over.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo6_2037
text_en: Also ideal for holding your brother's face up to until he screams.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo6_2038
text_en: ‘Happiness is a lawn sprinkler’. Put that on a greetings card.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo6_2039
text_en: You seem in a good mood today. I’m glad to see that.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo6_2040
text_en: I am. And I don’t see why I should keep it to myself. So I’m suffusing the whole Mall with it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo6_2041
text_en: Isn’t that a bit like drugging people?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo6_2042
text_en: Broadcasting a positive mood? Why not. I can’t see how that’s any different to playing music.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo6_2043
text_en: So today’s the day I might see Arthur smile?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo6_2044
text_en: ... great. Here I am trying to be the secret happiness fairy sprinkling joy, and instead I get to be the evil drug goblin. My happy mood just nosedived.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo6_2045
text_en: Oh! Nice analogy!

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo6_2046
text_en: Maybe. I hope so. He’s had to put up with so much.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo6_2047
text_en: Fine. I'll stop.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo6_2048
text_en: If Aoi can influence the mood through music, I can do it through vibes, right?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo6_2049
text_en: So much has changed since you came. I don’t just mean you and me. I mean all of it. Even the Mall.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo6_2050
text_en: I’m glad Aoi persuaded me to stay. Bless her.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo6_2051
text_en: Wait. She did what?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo6_2052
text_en: Back up. I missed something.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo6_2053
text_en: I didn’t tell you?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo6_2054
text_en: Ah. This was not long before you arrived. We’d been out all day trying to stamp out a Techrot hive. There was a murderous tension in the air. Fighting usually burns the anger out of us and leaves us too exhausted to lash out at one another, but this day was different.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo6_2055
text_en: I remember Arthur said something like ‘we do this all again tomorrow’ and it hit us all like a sledgehammer. Nobody spoke a word on the ride back to the Mall.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo6_2056
text_en: Wow. Way to boost team morale, Arthur.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo6_2057
text_en: He can be such a charmer...

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo6_2058
text_en: He has a lot on his shoulders. That takes a toll.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo6_2059
text_en: Yes. Usually he manages to hide it, even when he's running on fumes. But I guess he just had nothing left.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo6_2060
text_en: He'd burned himself out trying to keep the team together.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo6_2061
text_en: I think he was just trying to get us to focus on the job. But I just felt broken. Arthur and Aoi weren’t speaking, Amir was getting on Quincy’s nerves so much I was starting to fear for his life, and Lettie was side-eyeing me every chance she got.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo6_2062
text_en: I spent a lot of time looking into mirrors that day. I kept imagining my reflection grabbing me by the throat and hissing ‘YOU are the problem. If it wasn’t for you, none of this would be happening.’

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo6_2063
text_en: Sounds like everyone else had gotten into YOUR head for a change.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo6_2064
text_en: That sounds like the kind of crap Lettie comes out with.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo6_2065
text_en: Oh, this wasn't them. This was me. Every pent-up scrap of self-doubt and self-hatred I'd been keeping down came surging up that day.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo6_2066
text_en: Thank you. I know you’ve got my back, and it means a lot to me.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo6_2067
text_en: I thought to myself: what this group needs is a scapegoat.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo6_2068
text_en: I’d heard that line from Lettie so many times, I ended up thinking to myself: maybe she’s right. I’m putting everyone in danger by staying here.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo6_2069
text_en: A monster. Someone to blame.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo6_2070
text_en: I came up with a whole plan. I’d slip away in the night, hide out in the city somewhere Arthur would never find me, and - this is the part I was most proud of - carry on helping at a distance.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo6_2071
text_en: I think he’d have found you. He’s pretty determined.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo6_2072
text_en: The more likely scenario is that he would have died trying to find you.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo6_2073
text_en: How? Amir can’t trace telepathy.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo6_2074
text_en: Trying to guilt me?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo6_2075
text_en: I was going to be a noble exile. I’d crouch on rooftops looking all windswept and resolute. I could report on Techrot buildup, let the Hex know where the Scaldra were setting up roadblocks, even act as an emergency comms relay. Every time I saved Lettie’s arse, I’d really make her feel it. Petty? Definitely.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo6_2076
text_en: Don't bother. I feel dreadful enough already.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo6_2077
text_en: I chose my moment. I waited until Amir was asleep. Then I pulled a long coat on and headed for the garage as silently as I could.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo6_2078
text_en: The security grate came down by itself. I turned around and there Aoi was.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo6_2079
text_en: We talked all night and cried in each other’s arms. She was hurting, too. Deeply. By the time the sun came up, I’d decided to stay.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo6_2080
text_en: There’s still time to change your mind.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo6_2081
text_en: Aoi’s wonderful. I’m glad she was there for you.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo6_2082
text_en: That was lucky.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo6_2083
text_en: Whatever grotesque impulse led you to write that, I hope you choke on it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo6_2084
text_en: Yes. All six of us needed to be here on New Year’s Eve, I think. And you, of course. The stranger at the door, bringing good luck.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo7_2085
text_en: Is ‘The Indifference’ what it IS, or what it WANTS?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo7_2086
text_en: You and Lettie both do that, you know. You forget to say "Hello."

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo7_2087
text_en: Most people would start with "hello."

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo7_2088
text_en: [Ignore.]

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo7_2089
text_en: You have found the one thing we share, congratulations. And sorry. This is more important.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo7_2090
text_en: Sorry. This is more important.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo7_2091
text_en: I think ‘The Great Indifference’ is going to try to get between us, somehow.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo7_2092
text_en: Don’t laugh. I can feel it, deep down in my bone marrow. The thing that was in Rusalka would love to see us tearing each other into pieces.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo7_2093
text_en: I don’t know why. I just know.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo7_2094
text_en: Yeah. I think you’re right.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo7_2095
text_en: Maybe that’s what happened to Entrati’s family. They’ve been living right on top of his lab for years, without knowing it. When the kid found them, they were estranged, wallowing in spite.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo7_2096
text_en: I’ve seen it in your head. Albrecht and Loid. Mother and Father. You and your parents. Rusalka and Viktor, for all we know. And the six of us, of course.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo7_2097
text_en: What this thing does is cold. Perverse. But there’s a motivation behind it, somewhere.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo7_2098
text_en: I think you’re right. On the Zariman, the parents were the first to lose their minds. Maybe the Holdfasts held out as long as they did because none of them had any children.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo7_2099
text_en: I don't like to presume to understand things that are basically *gods.* This thing is trying to understand emotions. It's just doing a bad job of playing with its toys.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo7_2100
text_en: Admirable theory, but we don't KNOW that, do we?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo7_2101
text_en: If you're right, then it's blameless. Childlike, almost. That doesn't fit with what we know. It's malevolent.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo7_2102
text_en: Just let it try to get between us. So help me Sol, I’ll end it. I’ll find a way.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo7_2103
text_en: There are powers in the Universe that thing can’t stand against. I choose to believe it with every atom of myself.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo7_2104
text_en: If it swallows me whole I’ll stick in its throat and choke it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo7_2105
text_en: That's a great way to die.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo7_2106
text_en: I don’t know how we’re going to do it yet, but I’m with you. We have to win.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo7_2107
text_en: I'm dead anyway in this scenario.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo7_2108
text_en: But at least I get to spit in its eye.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo7_2109
text_en: If this was a story, you’d come up with some clever trick. You’d dig up the giant’s stone heart and crack it with a swan’s feather, or trick it into throwing itself over a cliff.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo7_2110
text_en: You said you were a ‘journalist’. Those aren’t the sorts of stories you used to tell, are they? You told the truth, no matter how ugly it was.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo7_2111
text_en: If those old stories didn’t tell the truth, people wouldn’t have kept telling them.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo7_2112
text_en: I don’t mean giants are real. I just mean the old stories tell a different kind of truth.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo7_2113
text_en: We’re going to need more than fairy tales to get through this, no matter how inspiring they are.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo7_2114
text_en: I’ve lived in a kingdom made from stories. I know how powerful they can be.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo7_2115
text_en: I know. I wish I had more than instinct to go on.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo7_2116
text_en: We're confronting something vast, terrifying and outside our comprehension. Normally only children get to do that. That's why fairy tales exist.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo7_2117
text_en: I think the one thing all those giant-killer stories have in common is this: they’re all about learning the rules and figuring out how to be clever with them.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo7_2118
text_en: Some monsters are stupid. Some are compelled to be literal. Some have secrets. But you can’t win until you know the rules the monster’s bound by.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo7_2119
text_en: It’s stuck in the Wall. I’m not even sure what the Wall is.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo7_2120
text_en: I don’t think the Indifference is bound by any rules.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo7_2121
text_en: Doesn't matter. If it really is stuck, then we can deduce two things, can't we?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo7_2122
text_en: When did you stop being frightened of it, Eleanor?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo7_2123
text_en: It has to be! Even Gods have rules! No matter how powerful the Indifference seems, it’s not a God.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo7_2124
text_en: You beat Thrax. It doesn’t matter how many times you failed and ended up on your arse. You WON. Why shouldn’t you beat the Man in the Wall, too?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo7_2125
text_en: One, it can be trapped. Maybe even imprisoned.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo7_2126
text_en: And two, it WANTS something. It wants to get out. If we know what it wants, we're already one step ahead of it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo7_2127
text_en: I didn’t.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo7_2128
text_en: I’m just more frightened of losing you, okay?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo8_2129
text_en: I’ve been thinking. There’s something I need to do.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo8_2130
text_en: I’m going to need help.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo8_2131
text_en: Always here for you. What’s on your mind?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo8_2132
text_en: Can't chat right now, sorry. [End.]

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo8_2133
text_en: So. Christopher.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo8_2134
text_en: It's time I told you about Christopher.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo8_2135
text_en: Arthur's best friend. We were engaged. I thought I was in love with him.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo8_2136
text_en: To... make a very long and tragic story very short... Christopher died in a roadside bomb before we were married.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo8_2137
text_en: Perhaps I'll tell you the whole story another day. Perhaps I won't.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo8_2138
text_en: I'm telling you all this now because...

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo8_2139
text_en: I’ve been holding on to him for years. So has Arthur. We have a ritual every year in his memory. But not this year. I couldn't face it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo8_2140
text_en: I don’t know whether ghosts exist, but they might as well, because I’ve let him become one.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo8_2141
text_en: Don’t be so hard on yourself. You were in love with the guy.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo8_2142
text_en: Oh mate. I THOUGHT I was. I loved him, but I didn’t even know if I was IN love with him or not.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo8_2143
text_en: That sounds awful, doesn’t it? It’s true, though. At the time, it just didn’t seem important. Then he died, and that became what our story was all about.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo8_2144
text_en: Everything that I admired about him has just been overshadowed by how he died. I can’t think about him without this knot tightening in my stomach.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo8_2145
text_en: It’s not fair. TO HIM. He deserves better than that.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo8_2146
text_en: I understand. Totally. I made a choice to remember my parents the way they deserved.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo8_2147
text_en: What happened was terrible. There’s no getting around it. But we can’t let that be the only thing we hold on to.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo8_2148
text_en: So why do I feel so guilty?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo8_2149
text_en: Why do I feel like letting him go is the same thing as throwing him away?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo8_2150
text_en: Because you’ve carried him for so long you don’t know how to stop.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo8_2151
text_en: Gods. You’re bloody right, you know.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo8_2152
text_en: Because you're worried no one else would ever be capable of loving you.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo8_2153
text_en: Is that it? Am I that shallow?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo8_2154
text_en: I doubt even Christopher would love me in my current condition.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo8_2155
text_en: We’re useless at dealing with this, my lot. We bottle everything up. We put a brave face on and whistle in the trenches. It gets us through, just like it got our parents through. But we don’t know how to stop.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo8_2156
text_en: What should I do? How do I let go?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo8_2157
text_en: I don't feel I deserve EITHER of you right now

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo8_2158
text_en: I think... I want you to have ALL of me. I can't hold back part of myself in a state of endless mourning.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo8_2159
text_en: ... no. That's not fair. I'm not being fair to him at all, am I?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo8_2160
text_en: He wouldn't want to stand in the way of my happiness. He was kind.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo8_2161
text_en: I actually think Lettie could help.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo8_2162
text_en: You could write him a letter.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo8_2163
text_en: Talk to Arthur, maybe. He's been going through this grief with you from the start.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo8_2164
text_en: Lettie?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo8_2165
text_en: Part of me thinks that's a stupid idea. He won't read it. He's dead. But...

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo8_2166
text_en: Yes, he has. Maybe that's part of the problem. I know he's upset that I didn't keep up our little ceremony of remembrance this year.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo8_2167
text_en: Why her?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo8_2168
text_en: ... the more I think about it, the less stupid it seems.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo8_2169
text_en: I just... have to say goodbye to Christopher MY way this time. Once and for all.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo8_2170
text_en: She has a lot of experience. She knows all about commemorating the dead.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo8_2171
text_en: I’m sure if you asked her for advice, respectfully, she wouldn’t turn you away.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo8_2172
text_en: Yes. I'll do it. There are things I need to say to him. Things I never said when he was alive. Maybe then he can rest.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo8_2173
text_en: To Arthur he'll always be a lost brother, a fallen soldier. That's the mourning he knows and understands. But it's not mine.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo8_2174
text_en: Thank you for listening, and for the advice.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo8_2175
text_en: I can't do it Arthur's way any more. I think... if I just tell him that, he'll get it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo8_2176
text_en: I will never, ever forget this.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo8_2177
text_en: Thank you.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo8_2179
text_en: Yes.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo8_2180
text_en: It’s time.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo8_2181
text_en: I think I need to let go of a LOT of things.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo8_2182
text_en: Let me talk to her. If she tells me to piss off, then so be it. But at least I’ll have tried, right?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank5Convo8_2183
text_en: It’s got to be worth a try. Lettie’s not as heartless as people think.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo8_2184
text_en: I bet. Living like this, doing what we do every day, we all put up walls. We just forgot to put doors in them.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank5Convo8_2185
text_en: Thank you for beating your lovely head against my wall.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorQuincyWingman_2186
text_en: Quincy came to me and said the absolutely strangest thing. That you wanted to talk to me... about your 'feelings?'

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorQuincyWingman_2187
text_en: I really just wanted to apologize for the terrible things I said.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorQuincyWingman_2188
text_en: I just wanted to tell you that I have feelings for you.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorQuincyWingman_2189
text_en: I think he was "punking" you.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorQuincyWingman_2190
text_en: Well... seems like a poor choice for me to hold a grudge given our situation. If you mean it? I forgive you.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorQuincyWingman_2191
text_en: I... see.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorQuincyWingman_2192
text_en: And... truth be told? I can't help but admit that I've been harbouring some feelings for you...

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorQuincyWingman_2193
text_en: If you're serious about wanting to give 'this' a go, between us? I'd be willing to do the same.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorQuincyWingman_2194
text_en: And I would be keen to remind you that you had your chance.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorQuincyWingman_2195
text_en: I have no idea.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorQuincyWingman_2196
text_en: And why have you kept this to yourself until now?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorQuincyWingman_2197
text_en: Maybe I've been confused on how this all works.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorQuincyWingman_2198
text_en: Seems so. Well. If you'd like to give 'this' a go, I would be more than happy to.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorQuincyWingman_2199
text_en: But I'd also be lying if I didn't admit that I missed you and would be willing to give this another go, if you were.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorQuincyWingman_2200
text_en: I would love that.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorQuincyWingman_2201
text_en: Eh, no. Never mind.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorQuincyWingman_2202
text_en: As would I.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank6Convo1_2204
text_en: Oh Gods

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank6Convo1_2205
text_en: I have this idea for a mural

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank6Convo1_2206
text_en: You and me are in the town square with bits of Techrot all over the place, fighting side by side, giving each other a look that’s a bit more than just comradely affection.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank6Convo1_2207
text_en: You and me are in ancient Höllvania, in the time of gods and monsters

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank6Convo1_2208
text_en: Then up on a nearby roof is the God of Love, training his arrow on us both…

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank6Convo1_2209
text_en: We are facing off against an army of skeletons in rotting armour, while up above us sits the God of Thunder, scowling and judgemental

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank6Convo1_2210
text_en: ...And?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank6Convo1_2211
text_en: Uh oh...

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank6Convo1_2212
text_en: IT’S QUINCY IN LITTLE PINK SHORTS

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank6Convo1_2213
text_en: ...And?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank6Convo1_2214
text_en: IT'S AMIR

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank6Convo1_2215
text_en: Uh oh...

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank6Convo1_2216
text_en: WITH WINGS

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank6Convo1_2217
text_en: THE LOVE SNIPER

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank6Convo1_2218
text_en: ROLLING DICE TO DECIDE OUR FATE

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank6Convo1_2219
text_en: THE FULGUROUS FABLEMASTER

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank6Convo1_2220
text_en: That image will never leave my mind now. Thanks!

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank6Convo1_2221
text_en: I can't stop laughing.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank6Convo1_2222
text_en: You’re welcome.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank6Convo1_2223
text_en: That image will never leave my mind now. Thanks!

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank6Convo1_2224
text_en: I can't stop laughing.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank6Convo1_2225
text_en: You’re welcome.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank6Convo1_2226
text_en: I have to do this.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank6Convo1_2227
text_en: I’ve been trying to find the moment, you know. I can’t.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank6Convo1_2228
text_en: I’ve been trying to find the moment, you know. I can’t.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank6Convo1_2229
text_en: The moment?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank6Convo1_2230
text_en: The moment?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank6Convo1_2231
text_en: The moment when I realized I was in love with you, of course.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank6Convo1_2232
text_en: I remember thinking ‘well, this is bloody inconvenient, Eleanor, now you’re bound to make a complete fool of yourself.’

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank6Convo1_2233
text_en: But not when, or what we were doing.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank6Convo1_2234
text_en: I suppose I should say thank you. For listening to me. For entertaining all these wild fancies of mine. And, most importantly, for being my friend.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank6Convo1_2235
text_en: The moment when I realized that my life had been changed by you. When you had wriggled your way into my heart and become family.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank6Convo1_2236
text_en: Yours forever, E. xxx

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank6Convo1_2237
text_en: I... oh. I'm not ready for that kind of commitment... I'm sorry.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank6Convo1_2238
text_en: It doesn’t matter. I love you.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank6Convo1_2239
text_en: Well...

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank6Convo1_2240
text_en: I love you.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank6Convo1_2241
text_en: ... shit.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank6Convo1_2242
text_en: What's the bloody point? I ask you. What is the bloody POINT??

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank6Convo1_2243
text_en: My Drifter. You fell into my life and turned everything on its head. Of all the choices you could have made, you chose me. You left me wide-eyed and wonderstruck.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank6Convo1_2244
text_en: Can I interest you in some enthusiastic kissing, with an option to proceed to rampant sexual intercourse?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank6Convo1_2245
text_en: YES.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank6Convo1_2246
text_en: Let’s start with kissing and see where we end up.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorRank6Convo1_2247
text_en: Let’s take it slow. Kissing is plenty.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank6Convo1_2248
text_en: Excellent.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank6Convo1_2249
text_en: Mmm. Let's feel our way forward, then. Sounds perfect.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorRank3Convo6_2252
text_en: Slip him some Rathuum tapes if you get the chance. I think he'd love it.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorBirthdayConvo1_2314
text_en: Happy Birthday to the firstborn of the Nightingale family!

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorBirthdayConvo1_2315
text_en: Happy Birthday, monster lady!

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorBirthdayConvo1_2316
text_en: And I’ve never let him forget it. Heh.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorBirthdayConvo1_2317
text_en: Happy ordinary day, mere human annoyance!

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorBirthdayConvo2_2318
text_en: Happy Birthday, Eleanor. I’m glad you’re still here.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorBirthdayConvo2_2319
text_en: Thank you, dear Drifter. So am I.

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorBirthdayConvo2_2320
text_en: Congratulations on surviving to another birthday!

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorBirthdayConvo2_2321
text_en: You didn’t check. Luckily for you I am indeed alive right now. Because this could have been bloody awkward, couldn’t it?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorBirthdayConvo3_2322
text_en: Happy Birthday, Eleanor! Hope you’re enjoying it!

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/TxtEleanor_EleanorBirthdayConvo3_2323
text_en: I am. Everyone’s been very sweet, even those who are usually not. Maybe there’s hope for us yet?

name: /Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRomance/Choice_EleanorBirthdayConvo3_2324
text_en: … so is it hard to blow out birthday cake candles with that tongue of yours getting in the way?
